title: Senior Power Platform-utvecklare till vårt expertteam...
description:
*”-Jag älskar att arbeta nära slutanvändarna och att kunna skapa förändring hos kunderna snabbt genom Power* Platform-lösningarna” Så beskriver Dennis Järnstål det bästa med sin roll hos oss på Fellowmind. Nu fortsätter vi att växa inom Power Platform och här är chansen för dig att bli kollega med Dennis och våra andra experter inom området!


**Om rollen**
-------------

I rollen som Senior Power Platform-utvecklare hos oss kommer du att vara en central del av vårt expertteam som arbetar med att utveckla och implementera lösningar baserade på Microsoft Power Platform till våra kunder. Dina ansvarsområden kommer att inkludera design, utveckling och implementation av Power Apps och Power Automate-lösningar som stödjer våra kunders verksamhetsbehov;


* Utveckla skräddarsydda lösningar med hjälp av Power Apps (både Canvas- och Model Driven Apps) samt Power Automate
* Samarbeta med andra teammedlemmar för att säkerställa smidiga integrationer och funktionalitet
* Ge teknisk rådgivning och stöd till kunder kring bästa praxis och optimering av deras Power Platform-användning


När du börjar hos oss kommer du att få en mentor (trots att du redan idag är senior) för att komma in i rollen hos oss på Fellowmind på bästa möjliga sätt. Vi har en rad spännande projekt, så redan från dag 1 kommer du få visa vad du går för i riktiga kundprojekt. Viktigt att poängtera är att vi primärt jobbar med projektkonsulting och att du kommer få jobba mot en rad olika kunder i både implementations- och förvaltningsprojekt, vilket ger dig de bästa förutsättningarna till att vidareutvecklas på både ett professionellt och personligt plan.


**Varför Fellowmind?**
----------------------

Hos oss på Fellowmind får du chansen att jobba på en plats där utveckling aldrig står stilla och där du verkligen får göra skillnad - **på riktigt!** Tillsammans med härliga kollegor och spännande kunder lever vi efter våra värderingar: Always personal, Act with courage, Better together och Serious about fun.


Vår kultur är allt annat än tråkig – den är personlig, inkluderande och alltid i rörelse. Vi vill att du ska känna dig som en del av en arbetsplats där du får skapa lösningar, utvecklas och ha kul samtidigt. Vi är riktigt glada och stolta över att ha blivit utsedda till Sveriges Bästa Arbetsgivare – och vi kommer alltid fortsätta arbeta för att vara en plats där alla ska må bra och känna sig hemma.


**Vem är du?**
--------------

För att lyckas i denna roll behöver du ha en passion för teknik och en stark önskan att förbättra verksamhetsprocesser genom innovativ användning av Power Platform. Vidare ser vi att du har:


* Minst 4 års erfarenhet av arbete som utvecklare inom ramen för Power Platform
* Djup kunskap inom design och utveckling av lösningar med Power Apps (både Canvas- och Model Driven Apps) samt Power Automate
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Microsoft 365 & SharePoint Online
* Förmåga att förstå och översätta kundens verksamhetsbehov till tekniska lösningar
* Erfarenhet av att nyttja Dataverse i dina lösningar
* Kunskap inom Azure DevOps


Då du kommer jobba mot både svenska och internationella kunder är det en förutsättning att du är flytande i både svenska och engelska.


Har du utöver ovanstående en bakgrund som fullstackutvecklare med kompetens inom React och C# är det meriterande, då vår erfarenhet säger oss att man med denna bakgrund ofta har en djupare förståelse för det bakomliggande tekniska som kommer väl till hands när du jobbar med low code och no code.


**Det praktiska**
-----------------

**Start:** Gärna så snart som möjligt (helst igår), men vi har förståelse för att du har uppsägningstid att ta hänsyn till.


**Omfattning:** Heltid, kontorstider, men vi är givetvis flexibla och utgår från att det ska fungera för alla parter.


**Placering:** På något av våra centralt belägna kontor i antingen Stockholm eller Göteborg


Rekryteringsprocessen kommer att bestå av telefon-/teamsintervju, djupintervjuer, teknisk intervju och referenstagning.


Låter det som något för dig? Sök då gärna så snart du om möjligt då urval sker löpande.


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Java Developer
description:
**ComeOn Group in short**
 Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Operating more than 20 brands on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.
   

  

**The Website**
 The ComeOn.com website is a service-oriented web application with stability, high performance and user experience being top priority. The frontend is optimized for a multi-device web solution and the tech stack consists of HTML5, CSS3/4, JavaScript with React. For client side state management we make use of Redux. On the server side, the business logic is proprietary developed Java code together with open source frameworks and external integration modules. The database is a MySQL cluster with distributed and dedicated report servers and data warehouse. We are continuously looking for new technologies and innovative solutions to use in order to offer a very competitive gaming experience for our customers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 We are looking for a Java Developer to help us build the best gambling site on the Internet. In this role, you'll work across the full system stack and all stages of the development lifecycle in a collaborative, team-driven environment. You will be responsible for integrating with external systems, developing internal components and subsystems, and contributing to frontend development for both mobile and desktop platforms. You'll work closely with our business teams to design and deliver new features, leveraging modern technologies such as Java, Kafka, Docker, MongoDB, MySQL, React, and Spring Boot, with deployments as Debian packages or in Kubernetes. The role also involves navigating and improving a codebase built over 15 years by around 60 developers, finding safe and incremental ways to modernize it without introducing risk.
   

  

**Requirements**
**About you:**
* Strong Java skills and genuinely passionate about it
* You understand that reading code is more difficult than writing code
* At least 6 years of professional software development experience
* Experience building web applications and services
* SQL Knowledge
* You know how to get legacy code under test
* Curious and willing to share and exchange knowledge with team members
* Comfortable working in an agile team with developers, QA engineers, and product owners
* Experience with any of the following is a plus: Tomcat, Maven, Spring, MongoDB, Guava, Guice, MySQL, Nginx, Linux, Jenkins, Git, Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform
* Fluent in spoken and written English


**Benefits**
**So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?**
 ComeOn offers a competitive and consistent benefits package for our team members. While some benefits vary by location due to local needs and regulations, many are available company-wide, and we're proud to offer them to everyone:
   

  

* Fantastic quarterly or half-yearly team events
* Regular company events
* A 250 euro One-time Hybrid Allowance to help you set up your home office (or equivalent in local currency)
* Annual wellbeing allowance/ gym membership (location dependent)
* 40 days ‘Work from Another Location' (WFAL) entitlement to work from any other location around the world
* Regular Meals at the office


 At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.
   

  

 At ComeOn Group, we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assessing candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.
   

  

 Want to know more about us? Just visit any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!
   

  

 LinkedIn
   

  

 Instagram
   

  

 Glassdoor

title: Junior SW Developer
description:
**Join our Team**
**About this opportunity:**
 Are you a recent graduate ready to dive into a world where innovation, cutting-edge technology, and teamwork come first? At Ericsson we accelerate product development with fresh thinking, challenge traditional workflows, and actively contribute to open-source communities. We combine the strength of a global company with a start-up mindset – and now we want you on our team!
   

  

 We are now looking for a Junior Software Developer to join one of our development teams in Kista, Stockholm. Here, you’ll work in agile teams where everyone contributes their expertise and drives products from concept to delivery, with collaboration, creativity, and open communication as the keys to success.
   

  

**What you will do:**
* Develop exciting new features
* Maintain and improve existing products
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders and other teams
* Participate in creative meetings and brainstorming sessions
* Prototype new solutions
* Document and share knowledge
* Bring your own perspective and innovative ideas to the team


**The skills you bring:**
* BSc or MSc degree
* Fluent English
* Programming skills in object-oriented languages such as C/C++
* Knowledge of other languages like Golang is a plus
* Interest or experience in microservices, containers, or cloud technologies is valuable
* Good communication and collaboration skills
* Positive mindset, curiosity, and a can-do attitude


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 769567

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:
**Paf stands out from other gaming companies in the market! Not just because of what we do, but
 *why* 
 we do it.** 
  We were founded by the Red Cross, Save the Children, Public Health on Åland, and the foundation Dagens Barn, and our mission from day one has been to generate funds for the benefit of society.
 



 We’re proud to be an award-winning industry leader in responsible gaming, raising the bar and setting new standards that put players first. All our profit goes to charity, and we strive for a long-term sustainable business that care about our employees, customers, and society at large.
 



 Now, we’re looking for a skilled
 **Senior Frontend Developer** 
 to strengthen our growing frontend team.
 







  








 THE TEAM & ROLE 
 
 You’ll join a talented and skilled team, known for their collaborative mindset and passion for high-quality code. The team values clean architecture, thoughtful problem-solving, and open knowledge sharing. Here you'll see that everyone contributes, and everyone’s voice matters.
 



 The team is responsible for the whole stack from Cloudflare, through React applications and API servers (Backend For Frontend), down to the infrastructure in AWS.
 



 In this role, you’ll work across the entire development lifecycle; from idea and planning to implementation, deployment, and continuous improvement.
 










 YOUR PROFILE
 
 You are curious, driven, and love building great user experiences. You take initiative but are also a strong team player who communicates clearly and asks for help when needed.
 



**We believe you have:** 



* 5+ years of experience working with React
* Professional experience with TypeScript



**Bonus if you also bring:** 



* API design skills with GraphQL and REST
* Experience with headless CMS (like Sanity)
* Familiarity with Redis or similar technologies
* Hands-on cloud experience, especially with AWS


 WE OFFER 
 * A company with steady, purposeful growth since 1966
* A workplace that values creativity, autonomy, and wellbeing
* Generous remote work options and support for your home setup
* Occupational healthcare and insurance
* A culture that prioritizes long-term success over short-term stress; overtime is something rare at Paf.


 WORK SETUP
 
**In Sweden** 
 : Choose your working location; 100% remote, hybrid, or office based. Offices in Stockholm and Norrköping.
 



**In Mariehamn (Åland Islands)** 
 : Hybrid/remote, with 3 days per week in our beautiful, modern HQ. Enjoy weekly breakfasts, seminars, massage, an office gym, and more.
   

  




 PRACTICAL INFO
 
**Start** 
 : As soon as possible, depending on notice perio
   

**Type** 
 : Full-time, permanent with a 6-month probation period
   

**Location** 
 : Sweden or Mariehamn
   

**Application** 
 : Via our web form only (GDPR compliance)
   

**Recruitment Process** 
 : Includes a programming assignment, followed by tech interviews and a meeting with the hiring manager
   

  





 We review applications continuously and close the process as soon as we’ve found the right person.

title: Senior Dotnet Developer
description:
We're working with a fast-growing, product-focused tech company based in Stockholm that is looking to hire a Senior .NET Developer. This is a hybrid role, requiring a few days per week in their central Stockholm office. The team builds scalable backend systems that support a high-traffic, global user base, and they're looking for someone with a strong technical foundation who can contribute to long-term architectural decisions while remaining hands-on in daily development. All communication is in English, and the working environment is highly international.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* 6+ years of professional experience with .NET (C#, .NET Core/.NET 6+)
* Solid experience building and maintaining APIs and microservices
* Strong knowledge of SQL and relational databases such as PostgreSQL or SQL Server
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms, ideally Azure
* Familiarity with DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and version control (Git)
* Comfortable working in a hybrid model with 2–3 days onsite in Stockholm
* Excellent communication skills in English



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Experience working in a product-led or consumer-facing company
* Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, or other containerisation technologies
* Interest or background in telecoms, mobile services, or payments

title: Junior Project Developer - BeNeFrance (Part Time)
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

 With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Junior Project Developer for a Part Time position.
   

  

**👩‍💻 About The Role**
 As a Project Developer at Flower, you will be part of a fast-growing team in Europe focusing on the development of large-scale battery systems (BESS) and other types of flexible assets. You will support various development processes and tasks through the project lifecycle of BESS projects in order to reach Ready to Build, with a special emphasis on lead generation and origination. This is an exciting opportunity for a proactive and detail-oriented individual to make a real impact in a rapidly growing, mission-driven company.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Identify and generate new leads for grid connections and land plots to feed the BESS projects pipeline.
* Contribute to the origination and evaluation of greenfield, commercial & industrial (C&I), co-developed, hybrid projects as well as acquired BESS projects.
* Analyze grid capacity and conduct feasibility studies for new storage opportunities.
* Conduct research and analysis on land, grid infrastructure, permitting frameworks, and local market incentives.
* Coordinate permitting and environmental assessments, including stakeholder engagement and document follow-up.
* Work closely with Flower’s internal teams like Asset Developers, EPC, and more, to ensure technical alignment and strategic execution.
* Support asset developers with technical input for proposals, pitches, and tenders.
* Assist in evaluating technical, regulatory, and financial aspects of project documentation. Ensure compliance with all relevant permitting and regulatory requirements across project stages.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with external parties such as landowners, grid operators, local authorities, and communities.


**Who You Are**
* Currently pursuing or holding a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering, Renewable Energy, IT, or a related field.
* Strong analytical mindset with a keen eye for technical detail, project documentation, and data interpretation.
* Proactive and organized, with a strong sense of ownership and attention to detail.
* Familiarity with Python, GIS tools, or similar technologies is an advantage.
* Some experience in renewable energy project development and navigating grid connection processes.
* Proficiency in English; additional languages as French, Dutch or German is highly valued.


**📍 Location**
 Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**✉️ Apply**
 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 30 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the People & Talent Partner and the Head of BeNeFrance.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 Please note that we will begin reviewing applications at the end of August. Wishing you a wonderful summer! 🌸
   

  

*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Software Engineer
description:
**SSC is a leading, global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. The Satellite Management Service division in SSC is focused on providing high quality and innovative ground station services to our customers - the spacecraft operators. Together we help Earth benefit from Space.**
**What You Will Do**
 We offer the opportunity to join the Software unit within SSC Connect, which is entrusted to develop and maintain critical systems required to connect our customers with their satellites.
   

  

 Our core business is to deliver satellite data to our customers, and the Data Engineering team owns critical components in this process. Their software ensures fast and reliable data delivery, as well as providing great observability for our customers and Network Management Center.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer in the Data Engineering team, you will build and maintain:
   

  

* Systems used for data transfer and observability
* Data pipelines and KPI calculations
* Dashboards and reports.


**Who You Are**
 We think that you care – about your systems, your colleagues and your users. That you have a creative and analytical mindset. You take responsibility, drive your own initiatives and can learn and process technical details quickly. We also think that you appreciate both working autonomously and together with other people.
   

  

 You have a European citizenship and can travel within and outside Sweden if needed. As this position is critical to the operations of the SSC Services, it may include outside of standard working hours working and/or being part of an on-call team with up to 1 week on-call per month.
   

  

**What You Need To Know**
* B.S. Computer Science or Computer/Software Engineering, or similar experience
* System administration in Linux
* Managing and building containers
* Scripting and packaging in Python and shell
* SQL and managing databases
* Fluency in English.


**Desirable Experience**
* Automation for CI/CD and configuration management
* Cloud Services
* Big data frameworks
* Stream Processing
* Backend Engineering and REST-API design
* Dashboard Design and Visualization
* AI/ML Ops


**WE OFFER YOU**
* An opportunity to be part of the exciting space industry and help Earth benefit from Space.
* An excellent opportunity for personal development and challenging endeavors.
* To be part of international development projects with highly engaged teams.
* A workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.
* Possibility to work remotely part of the time (max 50%), and flexible work hours.


**Additional Benefits**
* In addition to vacation and traditional public holidays, we offer extra paid leave throughout the year, such as time off between Christmas and New Year, Ascension Day, amounting to 6-11 extra days depending on the calendar.
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year.
* Health benefits such as voluntary health insurance and regular health checks for eligeble employees.
* Access to a benefit bike through a tax-efficient leasing program.
* Support for employee-driven activities that promote connection, health, and culture across teams.
* Collective Agreement, including good pensions plans, parental pay and insurance.


**LOCATION**
 Stockholm or Kiruna.
   

  

**FURTHER INFORMATION**
 For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:
   

  

**Sveriges Ingenjörer** 
 : SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com
   

  

**Unionen** 
 : unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

**NEXT STEP** 
  

  

 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait to apply! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**
 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com

title: Senior Software Developer
description:
****More independence, freedom, and better pay****
 Coody believes in combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 It's not rocket science.
   

  

 Overpaid managers, fancy offices, and heavily burdened organizations are history.
   

  

 The tech talent of tomorrow deserves a new, independent, and well-paid standard.
   

  

 Welcome to what we call Gravity Free Consulting.
   

  

****Why Coody****
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a slimmed and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no luxurious conferences. But, what does this mean in practice?
   

  

**Maximized Compensation** 
 - Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 - No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security** 
 - Fixed salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shaping the Future** 
 - Projects and assignments for digital game changes like Mojang, Spotify, Volumental, Volvo Cars, Varjo, Toca Boca, Hemnet, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****This is Coody****
 We’re a diverse community of ambitious tech people from more than 14 nationalities working on exciting challenges with customers across Sweden, Finland, USA, and the UK in industries ranging from gaming, AR, EV, AI, Medtech and Fintech.
   

  

 Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy. Everything we do, we do to make sure individuals working here can live according to their own priorities and unique ambitions. A consultant-first environment where you have better control over your career.
   

  

 Explore our
 **Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that actually puts consultants first.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a Senior Software Engineer at Coody, you’ll be working on challenging and fun assignments for companies that you can be proud to have worked with. You’ll be a key player in designing and building scalable, robust applications in cloud environments, while also contributing to areas like working methods, product strategy, and maintaining a great team spirit.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to jump headfirst into new environments. We’re all about embracing new challenges as opportunities to grow, so if you thrive in a dynamic setting, this is the place for you. Typically, you’ll work on 1-2 assignments per year.
   

  

****Who you are****
 We’re looking for Software Engineers with
 **5+ years of experience** 
 and a proven track record of delivering real results. If you’ve got the following, you’re probably a great fit:
   

  

* Experience building scalable software in cloud environments
* Expertise in at least one modern programming language like TypeScript, JavaScript, Java, .Net, Golang, Kotlin, Rust, Ruby, Erlang / Elixir, Python (you get the idea), and related frameworks
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or something related
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Are you excited to take your career to the next level and meet the criterias? Apply now, and we'll be in touch shortly.

title: Senior Software Engineer

description:

They operate in a fast-paced environment, value ambition, and seek individuals who are driven by challenges and eager to push boundaries.

You will take ownership of key architectural decisions and work with cutting-edge AI tools and methods to drive productivity and innovation.

* Collaborate closely with product and operations teams to drive technical innovation.

**Why Join**

* Opportunity to work closely with industry leaders and rapidly grow your skills.
* Competitive compensation and benefits.



  





 If your interested in the role please apply below, or drop an email direct to me at b.emery@tenthrevolution.com
 



  





 I look forward to hearing from you!

title: Cloud Platform Engineer – Google Cloud (Central Platform Team)
description:
**Company Description**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for you who want to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for an experienced
 **Cloud Platform Engineer** 
 with deep expertise in
 **Google Cloud Platform (GCP)** 
 to join our
 **Central Platform Team** 
 . Our mission is to define governance, build centralized services, and empower our product teams to efficiently build, deploy, and scale applications and analytics workloads in our GCP environment.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who has delivered
 **enterprise-scale cloud solutions** 
 , influenced multiple teams across an organization, and thrives in building
 **secure, automated, and developer-friendly platforms** 
 .
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Enhance and evolve our GCP landing zone (Project Factory) and governance framework to provide a robust foundation for all product teams.
* Design and develop central platform services that improve developer productivity and operational efficiency (e.g., BigQuery Quota Control, BigQuery Slot Reservations, Workload Identity Federation, Privileged Access Management, Patch Management).
* Build automation and self-service capabilities to reduce manual intervention and accelerate delivery.
* Provide advisory and consultancy to product teams, sharing best practices, reviewing designs, and influencing architecture decisions.
* Ensure security, scalability, and performance are integral to all platform solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure consistent standards, patterns, and practices across the organization.


 Qualifications
   

  

**Must-Have Skills:**
* Proven expertise with Google Cloud Platform services such as Compute Engine, Cloud Run, Kubernetes Engine (GKE), BigQuery, Cloud DNS, IAM, and Shared VPC.
* Demonstrated experience in designing and deploying enterprise-scale landing zones on GCP, including foundational infrastructure, networking, security controls, and resource management.
* Proficiency in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform, Deployment Manager, or Cloud Deployment Manager for automated provisioning.
* Strong understanding of cloud governance, identity and access management, and compliance best practices.
* Experience setting up monitoring, logging, and alerting in GCP (e.g., Cloud Monitoring, Cloud Logging, Alerting Policies).
* Track record of delivering impactful solutions across multiple teams or projects within a large enterprise.


**Nice-to-Have Skills:**
* Experience with DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines for cloud infrastructure.
* Knowledge of cost optimization strategies in GCP.
* Familiarity with multi-cloud environments.


 Additional Information
   

  

* Work in a front-facing role with direct impact across multiple product teams.
* Be part of an innovative central platform team driving cloud transformation at scale.
* Opportunity to shape best practices and governance for one of the world’s leading fashion retailers.
* Collaborative and inclusive work culture with a focus on automation, enablement, and continuous improvement.


**Place:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Note:** 
***Please apply only if you are in Sweden***

description:
Are you a skilled Software Engineer looking for an exciting opportunity to work within a dynamic and collaborative team in the Valuation Area? We build the systems that ensure correct pricing of all financial assets in the bank.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Be part of every step in the software lifecycle working on design, development, testing and maintenance.
* Develop and maintain web services, APIs, frontend and backend applications.
* Embrace the DevOps mindset, “you build it, you run it”. Actively contribute to DevOps processes.
* Take care of daily operations, manage maintenance activities and ensure good delivery quality.
* Work with testing and verification of new functionality.
* Write efficient code with use of existing libraries and leverage output using AI-code assistants.
* In collaboration with solution architects and quants, determine the technical approach for integrating new algorithms into the existing application framework.
* Ensure that our solutions follow the bank's security and regulatory guidelines, are properly documented and integrated with existing monitoring and logging solutions.
* Work collaboratively with stakeholders across various departments including IT, finance, risk management, and compliance.
* Identify opportunities for process improvement through technology adoption, automation, and optimization.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Master or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or related discipline.
* Proven experience in software development and maintenance.
* Strong expertise in backend programming using languages such as Python, C# and JAVA, database programming in SQL and SSIS, and proficiency in RestAPIs and JSON.
* Knowledge of various front-end technologies / reporting solutions and web design tools - JavaScript/TypeScript, Angular, ASP.NET, Razor, Blazor, Qlik, Microstrategy, Power BI.
* Experience working on and configuring Windows Server, SQL Server and IIS platforms.
* Familiarity with deploying using CICD-pipelines and using code repositories like Bitbucket or GitHub Actions.
* Exceptional problem-solving skills coupled with outstanding communication abilities both written & verbal.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.
* Knowledge of financial instruments and valuation theory is a bonus.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.

* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.

 work with talented and motivated colleagues with an open and positive mindset. title: Backend developer with data engineering skills
description:
**Description:**
 We’re looking for a backend and data engineering developer to join our cross-functional Digital Procurement team. You’ll work in a modern tech environment alongside product owners, architects, and fellow developers to deliver scalable and business-critical backend solutions that support our procurement and payment flows.
   

  

 The team is developing solutions using Spring Boot, Kotlin, REST APIs, and a microservice-based architecture, with a strong focus on event-driven design. The team is also responsible for data products and works in close collaboration with the data analysts in the business. You will be instrumental in building systems and integrations that enable our core Source-to-Pay processes, including the flow of operational data into our central data platform. This is a hands-on development role with high exposure to business systems and operational flows – ideal for someone who is curious, fast-learning, and thrives in a dynamic, fast-evolving environment.
   

  

**Required technical skills:**
* 3+ years of backend and/or data engineering development experience in Kotlin and/or Java
* Experience with Spring Boot and REST API development
* Experience building event-driven systems and working with microservices
* Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data platform systems and tools, preferably in AWS S3, DBT, Snowflake and/or Power BI


**Nice-to-haves:**
* Interest in business-focused configuration and system management
* Experience with Procure-to-Pay (P2P) processes (Purchasing, Inventory, Warehouse)
* Experience integrating towards SAP S/4HANA
* Experience from ERP projects
* Experience working in manufacturing industry


**Who you are:**
* You learn fast and are motivated by solving complex problems
* You thrive in ambiguous and iterative environments
* You are hands-on, proactive, and comfortable when not everything is predefined
* You are team-oriented, collaborative, and curious about how technology supports real-world operations


 Start: 2025-08-19
   

  

 End: 2026-03-31
   

  

 Location: Stockholm 2-3 days per week onsite.

title: Software Engineer within Clinical Decision Support
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries*
**What is Clinical Decision Support?**
 CDS is an area of health information technologies that combines evidence-based knowledge and different kinds of patient data in order to generate and present helpful information to clinicians as care is being delivered. We develop standards-based, EHR-independent Clinical Decision Support (CDS) applications that aim to accelerate the learning and innovations of healthcare. At Cambio CDS, we are all passionate about improving healthcare by developing software tools to facilitate clinical decision-making at point of care.
   

  

**The position**
 Are you passionate about combining healthcare with software engineering? Do you want to contribute to the lives of millions? If your answers to both are true, the Cambio CDS team is the right place for you.
   

  

 We are looking for software engineers to help us reach new heights. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop and Maintain: Create and sustain cutting-edge clinical decision support tools within our diverse product portfolio.
* Server-Side Excellence: Write efficient and robust server-side code to power our applications.
* Client-Side Innovation: Design and implement seamless user interfaces using JavaScript and TypeScript.
* Embrace Learning: Cultivate a growth mindset by exploring and integrating new technologies.


**Our Tech Stack Includes**
* Containerization: Docker and Kubernetes.
* Backend Technologies: Java, Kotlin, and Spring Boot.
* Frontend Technologies: JavaScript, TypeScript, Web Components, Lit, Vue.js.


 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 As a person, you are a humble and responsible team player who loves problem-solving. You pay attention to details and follow things through. You are open-minded, curious and keen to learn new skills. Like us, you are passionate about improving healthcare and motivated by the potential of health IT.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Experience: 3+ years in web development with a strong foundation in modern web technologies.
* Client-Side Expertise: Proficient in CSS, HTML5, and JavaScript.
* Server-Side Proficiency: Familiarity with enterprise-level technologies such as Java, Kotlin and Spring Boot.
* Language Skills: Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


**It's a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience in the healthcare industry.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
* Knowledge of microservices frameworks and system integration.
* Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as Vue.js or Lit.
* Understanding of human-computer interaction, accessibility, UX, and graphic design principles.


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 As it is currently vacation season, we will begin the selection process and start scheduling interviews in
 **week 34** 
 . We appreciate your patience and understanding during this time.
   

  

 We’ll be in touch as soon as we have an update regarding your application.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
**CAMBIO- FOR A HEALTHIER TOMORROW**
 Welcome to a company where healthcare is improved every day. Here you will work with leading technology in a collaborative, trusting and empowering environment where your contribution will be appreciated and celebrated. In our caring culture you will have the opportunity to pursue different paths of professional growth. Seize the opportunity to do the most important work of your life
 **.** 
 Read more about us
 **here!**
**A healthier tomorrow also means taking care of those who make it possible** 
**-** 
 explore our employee benefits
   

  

 Learn more about our recruitment process here.
   

  

 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at our career site.
   

  

 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Backend Engineer | AI team
description:
***Backend Engineer | AI team***




  





**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Gdansk, Oslo, Sarpsborg
 



  





**Bring AI to Life at Scale — Join Simployer's Applied AI Team** 




 At Simployer, we’re shaping the future of HR technology. Our goal is simple but ambitious: to make it easier to be a great employer. Now, we’re entering a new phase — building a powerful internal AI platform to enhance all parts of our product suite.
 



  





 We’re looking for a
 **Backend Engineer** 
 who’s eager to apply cutting-edge AI tools to real products — someone who understands technology deeply, but who’s driven by the opportunity to create value with it.
 



  





**What We Offer** 



* **Collaborative Culture** 
 – Join a supportive, dynamic team dedicated to learning and growth.
* **Professional Development** 
 – Access opportunities to expand your skills and grow within the organization.
* **Competitive Compensation** 
 – Enjoy a market-aligned salary and benefits package.
* **Real Impact** 
 – Make a significant impact on our products, clients, and business.



  





**The Role: Build the AI Infrastructure Behind Our Products** 




 As a Backend Engineer in our AI team, you won’t be training models — you’ll be
 **putting AI to work** 
 across Simployer’s ecosystem. You’ll help extend our internal AI engine, integrate it into our domain modules, and make it accessible, reliable and scalable.
 



  





 You’ll work hands-on with C#, Python or TypeScript to build APIs and backend functionality that powers AI-driven features. Whether it’s contextual assistants, intelligent workflows or smart insights — your work will shape how AI becomes a native part of our platform.
 



  





 This is applied AI with impact — designed, built and shipped to production.
 



  





**Skills & Requirements** 




**What You'll Be Doing** 



* Develop and maintain our internal AI API and platform components
* Integrate AI features into existing backend modules across multiple domains
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the AI adds user value
* Stay up to date with AI developments and iterate based on what works
* Work closely with developers and QAs across Stockholm, Sarpsborg and Gdansk



  





 You’ll be joining a tight-knit, high-performing team that moves fast and values autonomy, ownership and delivery over job titles.
 



  





**You’ll thrive in this role if you have:** 



* **Solid experience with backend development in C#, Python or TypeScript** 
 — to build reliable, scalable code
* **A pragmatic, learning mindset** 
 — AI is evolving fast, and so are we
* **Strong problem-solving skills and autonomy** 
 — you can explore new code and figure out the context
* **3–5 years of hands-on experience** 
 — enough to contribute without needing a long ramp-up
* **Fluent English skills (written and spoken)** 
 — our teams are cross-location and international



  





**Bonus points if you also have:** 



* Experience with frontend tech like React
* Startup/scale-up mindset — getting value out fast, working across domains
* Strong communication and collaboration skills — explaining ideas and pushing projects forward



  





 We care more about your mindset than your résumé. If you’re the kind of developer who enjoys solving complex problems and thrives in teams where initiative is valued — we want to hear from you.
 



  





**Message from the Hiring Manager:** 




*Hi there! My name is Runar, and I’ll be your new manager. As a leader, I value collaboration, continuous improvement, and a proactive mindset. I can see that you bring strong commitment and a focus on delivery, and I’m excited to have you on our team!* 




  





*Here, you’ll have the opportunity to take ownership, make a real impact, and grow both personally and professionally. In our team, we value curiosity, accountability, and the drive to build reliable, high-performing solutions. Your expertise will be key to ensuring we deliver high-quality products that help shape the future of our company.* 




  





*I’m looking forward to working with you and seeing the contributions you’ll make to the AI team and to Simployer!* 




  





**Why This Role Is a Rare Opportunity** 




 This is not just another AI job. You’ll join early in a focused AI team with strong engineering DNA, a clear mandate, and executive support. You'll help define how Simployer uses generative AI not as a gimmick — but as a core value-driver across products and workflows.
 



 You’ll work closely with highly experienced developers and contribute to a platform that will shape the future of work tech — at scale, and in production.
 



  





**Ready to Shape the Future of Applied AI?** 




 If you're excited about turning AI potential into product value — and doing it in a team that believes in practical innovation — we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





 We know the perfect fit might not tick every box — if you think you can contribute, we want to talk.
 



  





**Why Join Simployer?** 




 By joining Simployer, you’ll be part of a dynamic, inclusive, and innovative workplace. You’ll have access to unlimited resources and extensive industry experience while working with a variety of exciting products. We’re building something big — join us and be part of a culture that values your growth and success. Together, we’ll change the HR tech game!
 



  





**Our Hiring Process:** 



1. **Intro Chat:** 
 A quick conversation with our recruiter to get to know you and for you to learn about us and the role (approx. 30 minutes).
2. **Logic test and Personality test (Alva Labs)** 
 – Discover how you’ll fit with our team.
3. **Meet & Greet:** 
 Meet with your future manager to dive deeper into your experience and discuss the role (approx. 1 hour)
4. **Case interview:** 
 Show us your skills through real-world problem-solving. (approx. 1 hour)
5. **HR Chat:** 
 Let’s talk culture, values, and your future with us. A casual chat to wrap things up, answer any last questions, and make sure we’re a perfect match (approx. 30 minutes).



  





**With the summer holidays approaching, this process will be paused during the month of July. But don't worry, we'll keep an eye on your application and pick up the conversation as soon as we're back!** 




  





 We can’t wait to meet you!
 



  





 At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.
 



  





**About the company** 




 Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?
 



  





**Contact Person** 




 Niklas Jonsson
 



 niklas.jonsson@simployer.com

title: Fullstack Data & AI Developer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 Join our Data Team as a Full Stack Applications/AI Developer, where you'll be at the forefront of transforming business processes through innovative Data & AI solutions. In this role, you'll develop comprehensive data heavy and AI applications that enhance operational efficiency across our organization. You'll work together with our Data Engineers & Analysts to create seamless, integrated systems that drive productivity and innovation. Experience in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is a plus but not required.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Data/AI Application Development:
+ Design, develop, test, and deploy full stack data heavy and AI applications that streamline business processes.
+ Integrate AI models with both front-end and back-end systems to ensure robust and user-friendly applications.

* Collaboration & Integration:
+ Work closely with the Data & Insights Team to translate business process into effective data and AI-driven solutions.
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of applications with existing systems.

* Innovation & Continuous Improvement:
+ Research and implement cutting-edge AI technologies and frameworks to drive continuous improvement.
+ Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in AI and full stack development.

* Optional Chatbot Development:


 Utilize experience (if applicable) in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots to enhance customer interaction channels.
   

  

**What We Want From You**
 For us, it is equally important to find the right fit on an interpersonal level between us and a new colleague as it is to find someone with the right experience and competence. Successful candidates also meet the following requirements
   

  

* Technical Expertise:
* Proven experience as a Fullstack Developer with a focus on AI and machine learning applications.
* Strong proficiency in Frontend and Backend technologies (e.g., JavaScript, Python, etc.).
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization tools is highly desirable.
* Experience with AI & ML frameworks (LangGraph, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, etc.) and RESTful API design.
* Collaborative Skills:
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capacity to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.
* Strong communication skills to clearly articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Preferred Qualifications:
* Experience in developing enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is an added advantage.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 100 000 consumers.

title: Rust Software Engineer
company_industry: Computers and Electronics Manufacturing and Technology, Information and Media
description:

 Join a Stockholm-based team building real-time bot detection software and global data pipelines. They work with Rust, modern cloud infrastructure (primarily AWS), and deliver daily across browser and mobile platforms.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Develop and maintain mobile SDKs for Android and iOS
* Support customers with SDK integration and troubleshooting
* Collaborate with threat researchers and data scientists

**What We’re Looking For:**

 If you're passionate about stopping bad bots and enjoy working with modern tech, we'd love to talk.

title: Software Engineer TPS Engineering
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**
 Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are leaders in precision radiation therapy, we're committed to ensuring everyone has access to the best cancer care possible. Are you as passionate about humanity and innovation as we are? Then we would love to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 At Elekta, we're expanding our Neuro business line treatment planning software team. We develop Leksell GammaPlan, a desktop Linux-based integrated treatment planning system for the Leksell Gamma Knife®. By designing efficient, reliable, and high-performance software solutions, your work will directly contribute to helping medical professionals plan personalized and precise cancer treatments. To learn more about the system you will help enhance, please visit: Leksell GammaPlan® | Stereotactic Radiosurgery | Elekta.
   

  

 You will be part of a collaborative team of
 **Software Engineers** 
 , working in our beautiful new office at "Forskaren", Stockholms building of the year. We work with the SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) environment to drive innovation in cancer treatment.
   

  

**We will be expanding our team with a mix of junior and mid-senior developers, with a mix of skillsets.** 
 Our product is a Linux-based system, largely written in C++, and we are looking for people who besides these skills also bring experience with one or more of the following areas applicable to such systems:
   

  

* GUI desktop application development
* Cyber security
* Virtualisation and cloud-connected systems
* Radiation therapy systems, dose handling, DICOM
* Maintaining and updating a customized Linux distribution
* Considerations of updateability/backward compatibility/etc. with an installed base of older products
* Configuration management, continuous integration pipelines, etc.


**Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:**
* Participating in all phases of software R&D projects, with a focus on requirement specification, design, planning, implementation, testing, and documentation, while adhering to company standards. We work in a regulated industry, so understanding and following procedures is vital.
* Evaluating technologies, methodologies, and products to enhance software development.
* Applying Agile principles and practices, following the SAFe methodology as part of a Scrum team.
* Understanding and adhering to Elekta’s quality system while contributing to its continuous improvement.


**What You Bring**
 To thrive in this role, you should enjoy working in an Agile team environment and be comfortable discussing, presenting, reviewing, and verifying your work and that of the team before it reaches end users. We work closely together with multiple other teams and functions within the company, so people skills are important.
   

  

**We also expect that you have:**
* 1-10 years of professional commercial experience in C++ development.
* Experience in a team-based environment with disciplined use of source code version control and branch management.
* A university degree in Computer Science, Engineering Physics, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* Professional proficiency in English.


**Hiring process**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact**
 For questions, please contact your Talent Acquisition Partner responsible, Agata Antonijczuk, at Agata.Antonijczuk@elekta.com.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to age, race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.
   

  

*As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope. Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit elekta.com or follow @Elekta on Twitter and LinkedIn.*

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
*Are you pro in ServiceNow and passionate about outstanding customer experience? Do you fluently speak Swedish?*
 In Tietoevry Tech Services Sweden AB, we modernize our customers IT landscape to drive efficiency, agility and innovation, and to realize their digital ambitions. Our customers are large Nordic organizations operating in various industries as well as in the public sector. Our aim is to become the market leader in the Nordics and the first choice for our customers’ business renewal. ServiceNow is one of the leading Enterprise Service Management Platforms and a focus area for Tietoevry in the Nordic market.
   

  

 We are now looking for ServiceNow Developers to perform creative work with our customers.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

* Work in DevOps model to implement/expand on-premise ServiceNow modules CSM and ITSM for our customers
* Implement/modify integrations using REST API or ServiceNow Integration Hub
* Contribute as ServiceNow developer in projects ranging from simple to complex
* Handle migration and cloning in various production and non-prod instances of ServiceNow


 We expect you to have
   

  

* Certified ServiceNow Administrator and preferably Certified Implementation Specialist in ITSM and CSM
* Minimum 3 to 4 years of hands-on experience in ServiceNow developer working for clients
* Strong technical knowledge about on-premise ServiceNow ITSM and CSM module
* Proven track record working in ServiceNow platform as technical consultant
* Ability to analyse and improve current implementation and solutions and ability to explain and present new ideas and solutions
* Ability to communicate well in Swedish and English
* Experience in implementing ServiceNow native automation capabilities are preferred


 As a person you are
   

  

* A good communicator who communicate well with customers and within organization
* Well-spoken, articulate and communicative
* Self-managed and well organized
* Able to work in global environment and with people


 What we offer
   

  

* With us, you get to make your mark in genuinely meaningful projects (for example, developing solutions including ITSM and CSM modules of ServiceNow integrating with 3rd party tools).
* We are a global family with Nordic heritage – low hierarchy, respect, trust, open and honest communication are essential part of our culture. With us, you will work with diverse team of experts in an inclusive environment where everyone is appreciated.


 We also offer you
   

  

* Empowerment, flexibility and work-life balance
* An ultimate combination of local and international team environments
* Numerous networking opportunities and external/internal communities
* Various opportunities both to learn and to share knowledge with others – in our team this means e.g. participating in ServiceNow trainings and conferences and getting relevant certifications


 To thrive in our dynamic and constantly changing working environment, you are a true customer champion, empathic collaborator and curious self-leader. As a customer champion you focus your energy and passion towards customer excellence, never compromising the quality of our work. You play to make the whole team win, sharing knowledge and seeking for feedback and dialogue. You also proactively set goals for yourself and curiously aim to discover how to change the world.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?** 
  

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager Amit Ambre, amit.ambre@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.*
*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.*
**About Tietoevry Tech Services**
 Tietoevry Tech Services is a leading transformation and managed IT services provider, focusing on Nordic-based private and public customers across industries. With our full scope of digital solutions, including applications, multi-cloud, data & AI and security services, we help businesses thrive and keep Nordic societies running.
   

  

 We are a global team of 7,000+ experts representing over 50 nationalities, delivering services to our customers by combining global capabilities with Nordic proximity. Guided by our values equality, transparency and trust, we aim to be the best possible place to work at. Now, we are looking for talented people who want to join us on our exciting journey towards becoming a standalone company and shape the digital landscape in the Nordics with us. Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good!
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Salesforce Developer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to grow ideas in an unconventional environment. At the same time, you’ll work in a culture of ongoing learning and development, allowing you to constantly expand your area of expertise.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Salesforce Developer with 5+ years of hands-on experience in designing, developing, and deploying Salesforce solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the Salesforce platform, including Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and custom applications using Apex, Visualforce, and Lightning Web Components (LWC).
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Design, develop, test, and deploy scalable and secure Salesforce applications using Apex, Visualforce, and LWC.
* Customize and configure Salesforce using Apex, Visualforce Triggers, SOQL, SOSL, API, Flows, LWC, JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
* Develop and maintain integrations with external systems using REST/SOAP APIs and middleware tools.
* Collaborate with stakeholders, project managers, business analysts, architects, and other developers to troubleshoot issues across environments and deliver enhancements.
* Participate in sprint planning, code reviews, and deployment activities.
* Conduct unit testing and participate in release and deployment activities.
* Adhere to Salesforce best practices for development, testing, and documentation.
* Monitor platform updates and proactively assess their impact on existing customizations and workflows to continuously improve the platform.


**Required Qualifications**
* 5+ years of hands-on Salesforce development experience.
* Strong expertise in Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Web Components (LWC), SOQL/SOSL, and Flow.
* Experience with Sales, Service and Community Cloud.
* Solid understanding of Salesforce data model, security, and sharing rules.
* Proven experience integrating Salesforce with ERP systems and custom applications using REST/SOAP APIs, and experience with tools like Postman or Workbench.
* Familiarity with DevOps tools like Gearset, Copado, or Salesforce CLI and Git-based version control systems.
* Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
* Salesforce certification is a plus


**Nice-To-Have**
* Exposure to Microsoft Dynamics 365 or similar ERP platforms.
* Experience working in CI/CD environments and agile teams.
* Understanding enterprise integration patterns and middleware tools.
* Background in supporting QA automation and test-driven development.


**Apply today!**
 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Experienced COBOL Developer –  in Payment Execution
company_industry: Banking, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
Would you like to participate in the creation of next generation’s payments platform? Have you worked several years as a COBOL Developer and look for a new challenge?
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:

* Assume full operational responsibility for the services owned by the team. Participate in maintenance, change & incident handling. Be ready to take on on-call duty going forward.

 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Solid experience within IBM Mainfraime and COBOL development
* Be curious, driven and an analytical problem solver who is comfortable solving complex tasks and finding a way forward even in unpaved areas

* FaultAnalyzer
* CMN Changeman (Librarian)
* MQ
* IMS

 With us, you can experience:

 "Join our team and...

 **Patrik Forsblom, your future manager**

 Sundbyberg

 Patrik Forsblom, +46 70 3495886
   

  

 We want to inform you that the selection process may begin after the summer holidays.
