title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
**Ready to share our passion for customer support?** 
**🦸**
 Nice to meet you! I’m Shweta Malhotra, a Talent Acquisition Partner at LeadDesk. Together with Guro Andersen, our VP Customer Success and Tuukka Laaksonen, our Technical Support Manager we’re strengthening our team in Sweden. We are hiring two new team member to work with Zisson products.and another to work for one for LeadDesk
   

  

 You will serve as the initial point of contact for our customers, providing timely assistance and technical support. You will play a vital role in diagnosing issues, delivering solutions, and ensuring a seamless customer experience. Your contribution will be critical to maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction and upholding our service standards.
   

  

 We’re searching for the ideal candidates to strengthen our team and can’t wait to welcome the
 **2 (Two) Technical Support Specialists**
**What’s in it for you** 
  

  

* This is a pivotal role that will significantly influence the strategic direction of LeadDesk’s product offerings. You will play a key role in delivering complex products more systematically, faster, and with greater impact.
* You'll be at the forefront of product development, working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with our strategic vision.
* Opportunity to enhance your product management skills and advance your career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* Flexible office hours and a hybrid work model: Enjoy a mix of remote and onsite work (3 days a week) at our Sweden office.
* Join a publicly listed SaaS company that develops its own technology and is committed to innovation.
* Experience a truly international work environment, collaborating with talented colleagues from 27 nationalities across 8 countries in a multicultural and diverse setting.


**What you can expect as a Technical Support Specialist at LeadDesk**
**Customer Support**
* Act as the first point of contact for customers seeking technical assistance via phone, email, or live chat.
* Taking customer calls, troubleshooting issues with customers and handling customer tickets.
* Deliver prompt and professional responses to all inquiries.


**Technical Troubleshooting**
* Identify, analyze, and resolve technical issues related to software, hardware, network connectivity, and other solution-related components.


**Customer Feedback**
* Collect and document customer feedback and communicate insights to relevant teams to support continuous improvement of products and services.


**Escalation Handling**
* Collaborate with second-line and specialist technical teams to escalate and follow up on complex issues, ensuring timely and effective resolution.


**User Education**
* Guide customers on how to use our products and services efficiently, offering training, documentation, and resources to enhance the user experience.


**Collaboration With Other Teams**
* Will be working according to support ways of working, KPI’s and processes in close collaboration with sales and Customer Success.
* Will play a crucial role in strengthening the collaboration between our Sales team and the broader support organization.
* Will be part of Support matrix organisation.


**This is where the match happens**
**Must-haves**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
* Strong technical understanding or background like tech support, troubleshooting issues etc.and genuine interest in technology
* Interest in IT things, has used different programs (eg. Zendesk for ticketing, some VoIP calling system, CRM etc.)
* Fluent in Swedish and English; proficiency in Norwegian would be an advantage and considered a plus


**Nice-to-haves**
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Technical proficiency in troubleshooting hardware, software, and network issues.
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong customer service orientation and the ability to remain calm under pressure.
* SQL
* Python, or any programming languages
* Contact Center experience


**Practicalities (example, change as agreed)**
* Your location: Sweden Metropolitan area
* Work permit in Sweden
* Start date: As soon as possible
* Work model: Hybrid
* Working hours: flexible
* Employment: Full-time and permanent


**What’s Next**
 We can’t wait to meet you! Apply today or
 **latest by 30th August'25**
 For more information, please reach out to Shweta Malhotra from the Talent team by email: ext-shweta.malhotra(at) leaddesk.com.
   

  

***LeadDesk briefly***
*At LeadDesk, our purpose is to simplify human connections between organisations and people across Europe. Every year, our AI-powered platform connects more than 500 million customers with call center agents.*
*When it comes to our employees, we believe that each of us is a Leader. Someone with a lot of ambition, drive, and readiness to take (and receive!) ownership from day 1.*
***We welcome people from all backgrounds and walks of life, which is reflected in our diverse community of Leaders. As an employer, we're committed to providing equal opportunity for all employees and applicants.***

title: IT & Operations Manager
description:
*Are you looking for a meaningful role?*
 Join Doconomy, a market leader in impact technology, here to rewrite the financial system. We are dedicated to driving global climate action by equipping banks with innovative financial tools that educate and foster positive change.
   

  

 Our groundbreaking ecosystem of tools combines expertise in behavioral science to design financial services that make it simple and enjoyable to save and invest money, all while reducing environmental impact. By integrating these solutions into existing banking apps, we help people achieve their financial goals and contribute to a sustainable future.
   

  

 With over 100 clients in 40 different markets, including key partnerships with organizations like the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), Mastercard, S&P Trucost, and the World Wildlife Fund (WWF), Doconomy is at the forefront of the industry. We are backed by leading investors such as Mastercard, Ingka Group, Citi Ventures, CommerzVentures, S&P Global, ABN Amro Ventures, and UBS Next.
   

  

 Our diverse team includes former bankers, engineers, developers, designers, brand strategists, ESG experts, behavioral science experts, and thought leaders in innovative business and service design. We bring expertise from some of the world’s largest digital and sustainable banks, corporations, and fintechs, ensuring we remain best-in-class.
   

  

 More than ever, we have the opportunity to help make financial well-being and sustainable living a reality for millions. We are looking for bright, courageous, and passionate individuals to join our impact-driven team in shaping the future of the finance industry.
   

  

***Join us!***
 We’re looking for an enthusiastic and proactive
 **IT & Operations Manager** 
 to join our team in Stockholm.
   

  

 Your main focus will be
 **IT support and infrastructure management** 
 , ensuring smooth day-to-day operations and acting as the go-to person for technical assistance. You’ll keep our systems running, our devices configured, and our colleagues supported; always with a friendly, solutions-focused approach.
   

  

 Alongside your core IT responsibilities, you will also contribute to
 **operations and project management** 
 across the company. This might include coordinating cross-team initiatives, supporting events and meetings, or taking on administrative projects that help the entire organization run efficiently.
   

  

 This is a great opportunity for someone who loves technology but also enjoys variety, collaboration, and driving operational success.
   

  

***What you'll do***
**IT (Primary Responsibilities)**
* Provide timely and professional technical support to colleagues across the organization via phone, email, and ticketing system.
* Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, and network-related issues.
* Document, track, and prioritize support requests using the ticketing system.
* Resolve incidents and requests efficiently, meeting service level agreements (SLAs).
* Install, configure, and maintain hardware and software; laptops, conference systems, printers, and peripherals.
* Handling on and offboarding, ensuring colleagues have the necessary access and equipment.
* Maintain and support IT systems and infrastructure.
* Collaborate with other teams to improve IT processes and deliver a great user experience.
* Provide training and guidance to colleagues on IT best practices, security protocols, and system usage.
* Continuously improve the IT Service Desk and other IT functions.


**Operations (Secondary Responsibilities)**
* Coordinate and support cross-department projects.
* Assist with planning and follow-up for meetings, events, and company activities.
* Help streamline processes and improve workflows across teams.


**What You'll Bring To The Team**
* Proven experience in an IT support or operations role.
* Strong knowledge of IT systems, hardware, software, and network technologies.
* Experience with ticketing systems, including Jira.
* Experience supporting MacOS and managing devices through Apple Business Manager and Kandji.
* Proficiency with Google Workspace administration.
* Understanding of IT security principles and practices.
* Excellent communication and service skills, with a problem-solving attitude. (English is our working language)
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a startup environment.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* A proactive and enthusiastic approach to learning new technologies and improving processes.
* Familiarity with hybrid work environments and strong advocacy for hybrid work models.


*****Preferred Qualifications*****
* IT certifications such as CompTIA A+, ITIL Foundation, or similar.
* Familiarity with cloud-based solutions beyond Google Workspace (e.g., Office 365).
* Knowledge of IT asset management and inventory control.
* Familiarity with HubSpot or other CRM systems.
* Experience with project coordination or event support.


**What We Offer**
* Location & Flexibility: We offer a hybrid work setup, with 3 days a week spent collaborating in our vibrant A-house Östermalm office, and 2 days working remotely from wherever you’re most productive.
* Team: Join a diverse, international team working in cross-functional groups.
* Tools: Stay connected and manage projects efficiently with collaborative tools like Slack, Miro, and Google Workspace.
* Equipment: Work with the latest Apple devices and equipment to support your best performance.
* Insurance & Wellbeing: Stay well with a comprehensive Health and Accident insurance, plus access to Mindler for mental well-being support.
* Pension: Benefit from a generous 10% occupational pension plan.
* Wellness: Receive a wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year.
* Time Off: 30 days of paid vacation, plus 2 extra self-care days for when you need a little extra time off.


 We have an ongoing recruitment process – if this role is online, it means it’s still open!

title: IT-Supportansvarig
description:
**Om jobbet:**
 Vi söker en IT-supportansvarig som vill ta helhetsansvaret för vår kunds IT-supportfunktion och se till att verksamheten rullar smidigt varje dag. Här får du en varierad roll med allt från hands-on felsökning till utveckling av rutiner och processer. Du kommer att vara den som medarbetarna vänder sig till när det gäller datorer, mobiltelefoner, mötesteknik eller användarkonton och du ser till att de alltid får snabb och proffsig hjälp.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som IT-supportansvarig har du det övergripande ansvaret för att IT-supporten fungerar smidigt. Du leder och samordnar supportarbetet, stöttar kollegor i IT-relaterade frågor och driver förbättringar som höjer kvaliteten och effektiviteten i IT-leveransen.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**
* Ansvara för och utveckla IT-supportfunktionen – från dagliga ärenden till långsiktiga förbättringar
* Ge support för datorer (Windows och Mac), mobiltelefoner och surfplattor
* Felsöka och lösa problem i PC-, Mac- och iOS-miljöer
* Hantera användarkonton och rättigheter i Active Directory och Microsoft 365
* Säkerställa att mötesteknik fungerar och ge stöd vid större möten och digitala event
* Hålla enklare utbildningar och onboarding vid systemuppdateringar eller nya verktyg
* Dokumentera rutiner och skapa guider för att underlätta vardagen för användarna


**Vi söker dig som har:**
* Minst två års erfarenhet av IT-support i Microsoft-miljö
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Windows 10/11, Office 365 och Microsoft Teams
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med iOS-enheter och gärna blandmiljö Mac/PC
* God kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Meriterande:**
* Kunskap inom Azure, Entra och ITIL


**Som person är du:**
* Självgående, strukturerad och serviceinriktad
* Tålmodig och lösningsorienterad
* Prestigelös och bra på att samarbeta
* En person som bidrar med positiv energi i vardagen


**Om CONSULTING it:**
 När du börjar hos oss som konsult på CONSULTING it blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får dessutom kollegor runt om i Sverige! Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stöttar dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen – i ditt nästa, nästa och nästa steg. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö!

title: Junior systemutvecklare
description:
Vill du använda din problemlösningsförmåga och skriva kod som har betydelse för många? Du får möjlighet att utvecklas samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnyttan. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Skatteverket har höga ambitioner att bidra till den digitala transformationen som sker i Sverige. Skatteverkets IT-avdelning är en av Sveriges största med drygt 1000 medarbetare som ansvarar för utveckling, drift och förvaltning av Skatteverkets IT-landskap.
   

  

 På IT-avdelningen utvecklar vi bland annat digital infrastruktur för andra myndigheter och för hela Sverige, vi samverkar även med andra myndigheter. AI-lösningar för snabbare och effektivare hantering av information, lösningar för hantering av moms och arbetsgivaravgifter samt datalager för skarpare analyser och bättre styrning.
   

  

 Vi arbetar agilt med stöd av ramverket SAFe och du är med och påverkar den förändringsresan. Du arbetar i ett agilt team där ni tillsammans ansvarar för både utveckling och förvaltning. Du får möjlighet till varierande arbetsuppgifter med utvecklingsmiljöer som omfattar flera generationer av teknik, plattformar och verktyg.
   

  

 Skatteverket är på väg över till en ny teknisk plattform baserad på RHEL och OCP. I rollen som systemutvecklare finns det möjlighet att utvecklas inom container teknik.
   

  

 Tillsammans med dina kollegor har du roligt på jobbet samtidigt som du bidrar till samhällsnytta. Vi är en stor IT-avdelning som erbjuder dig utvecklingsmöjligheter både på djupet och på bredden. Du har flexibel arbetstid och det är en självklarhet för oss att du har balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Du tillhör IT-avdelningen, med placering i Sundbyberg.
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* vara resultatinriktad och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och kunna ställa om vid förändringar
* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* ha god kommunikationsförmåga i tal och skrift på svenska
* kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar.


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* nyligen avslutad högskole-/universitetsutbildning inom it
* aktuell och relevant erfarenhet av programmering i Java


 Det är önskvärt att du har erfarenhet av Javascript, C#, GIT, Springboot, OCP, integration och/eller automatiska test.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och inleds med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/578 | Kontakt: Malin Fredriksson (rekryterande chef) malin.fredriksson@skatteverket.se, Matilda Sandring (hr-specialist) matilda.sandring@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-07-25 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-15

title: Microsoft Security Architect
description:
As a Microsoft Security Architect, you will play a key role in designing and implementing security solutions based on Microsoft technologies. You will also conduct workshops and collaborate with other security specialists within the team to ensure our customers' cybersecurity. In this role, you will be a central figure in the implementation of SOC (Security Operations Center) customers. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to work hands-on with the security products that Fujitsu offers.
 



  





**Main Responsibilities:** 




  




* Design, implement, and maintain security solutions based on Microsoft technologies.
* Work closely with security specialists to ensure robust and efficient security solutions.
* Conduct Microsoft Security Workshops for customers.
* Lead cybersecurity projects from start to finish, including migrations and implementations.
* Implement and maintain SOC services using Microsoft as the SIEM platform.
* Work with incident management, identity management, and cloud security.



  





**To succeed and thrive in this role, you should have some of the following:** 




  




* In-depth knowledge of Microsoft security products and services.
* Experience implementing SOC services with Microsoft as the SIEM platform.
* Experience with Microsoft XDR and other security products within the Microsoft ecosystem.
* Previous experience in IT security and Microsoft technologies.
* Technical expertise and the ability to engage in customer discussions about solutions.
* Experience with PKI and Active Directory.
* Architectural background in IT security or related fields.
* Relevant education in the field.
* Swedish citizenship.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English.



  





**Location & Start Date:** 




 Location: Stockholm, with the possibility of hybrid work.
 



 Start date: As agreed.
 



  





 We are a Disability Confident Employer and will offer an interview to disabled applicants who meet the minimum/essential criteria for the role. Email EMEIArecruitment@fujitsu.com if you would like to apply through the Disability Confident Interview Scheme.
 



**Achieve together** 




**We are recognised as a responsible and inclusive employer:** 
 Not only are we a certified Disability Confident Leader, a Times Top 50 employer for Gender Equality, a Top 75 employer for Social Mobility, accredited with the Living Wage Foundation and a signatory for the Race at Work Charter, but we are also committed to the United Nations standards for LGBTI+ and a Stonewall Top 100 Employer.
 



**We are people centric:** 
 Our work environments enable you to
 **Be Completely You.** 
 Our active people-led Inclusive Community networks are representative of all aspects of diversity and are instrumental in enabling and supporting our innovative approach to inclusion.

title: Cloud Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and IT System Design Services
description:
***Cloud Architect & Engineers - AWS***




***Leading Nordic IT Consultancy Company - Sweden***




  





 Would you like the opportunity to join Sweden's fastest-growing IT organizations in the Nordics, renowned for delivering secure and cutting-edge Cloud solutions to high-profile enterprises and public entities.
 



  





 In the last 3 years they have grown their market leading business to over 500 colleagues, with significant growth and investment occurring in their cloud division. They work with the largest enterprises in the Nordics and cover the entire spectrum from public cloud to private cloud, including air-gapped solutions for defense and national security. Some of the assignments may therefore require security clearance.
 



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* 3+ years experience of Cloud Architecture in AWS.
* Nice to have - Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) or Well-Architected Framework (WAF)
* Swedish speaking, Swedish citizenship.
* Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform or CloudFormation)
* DevOps & CI/CD - GitHub Actions or similar tools



  





 You don't have to be an expert and know all of this, but you must be both curious and willing to learn.
 



  





**Some of what they offer:** 




  




* 6 weeks vacation and certification bonuses
* Good pension and insurance schemes
* Contribution to SATS membership and access to company cabins
* One of the Nordic's largest professional community within cloud technologies, where knowledge sharing is central



  





  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful, we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: Business Development Representative
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
**Company Description**
 Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,200 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 15 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide
   

  

**Job Description**
**Why is Nexthink looking for Exceptional BDRs?**
 Nexthink is a rapidly growing software company that is driving towards an IPO while redefining the employee Digital Experience across enterprise organizations around the world. In order to continue and fuel our growth we need smart, driven, and hungry to succeed and grow Business Development Representatives. If you want to speak with forward thinking leaders in Information Technology for Global 2000 organizations then you belong here.
   

  

**What Makes a Great Nexthink BDR?**
 We are looking for energetic/passionate people who want to break into the enterprise software space and begin to build a sales career! You will work closely with our enterprise sales & marketing teams to drive new opportunities through outbound efforts and learn from some of the best! We focus on the value for our customers, and your job will be to convey that to new prospects so they can join our expanding Nexthink community!
   

  

 We are a tight-knit team focused on building our global business and driving towards an IPO. If you have ever wanted to be a part of an exciting organization with the potential for rapid growth, then now is the time! We have the agility of a start-up with the backbone of a larger organization with more than 500 employees worldwide.
   

  

**What would you be doing?**
* A strong pipeline is the key to successful sales.The BDR is a critical contributor to the pipeline growth by generating encounters between an ideal persona identified within our prospect and a sales representative.
* Conduct research and collect insights in line with our Ideal Customer Profile Strategy to create warm introductions to our prospects.
* Outbound prospecting via various channels: including field marketing events participation outbound emails sequences, leveraging social networks activities and Nexthink assets.
* Qualify and convert inbound leads.
* Suggest Sales and Marketing initiatives to drive the pipeline.
* Create qualified opportunities alongside our sales team.
* Collaborate and contribute actively to marketing campaigns: follow up with Qualified leads.
* Effectively articulate the value of our Nexthink solution to both technical and non-technical buyers.


**Qualifications**
* Fluency in English and Swedish is required for business communication with regional stakeholders
* University degree in a business subject or relevant experience previously in business development.
* A fast learner who is always looking to improve and grow. Passionate and driven to excel.
* Strong communication skills (both written and verbal)
* Confident, outgoing personality who can drive pipeline activity.
* Great team player, easygoing, must be able to work well with others, teamwork.
* Experience in working in a fast paced, metrics-driven sales environment.
* A demonstrable track record of exceeding targets


**Additional Information**
 We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.
   

  

 With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages

title: IT-Support
job_function: Information Technology, Administrative, and Customer Service
description:
**Är du den vi söker?** 




*Har du ett brinnande intresse för IT, gillar att lösa problem och trivs med att ge service i världsklass? Vill du vara en del av ett team där du får utvecklas, ta ansvar och arbeta med modern teknik – samtidigt som du hjälper andra? Då kan detta vara ditt nästa uppdrag!* 




  





*Nu söker vi dig som vill arbeta med IT-support i en varierad och lärorik roll till vår kund i Solna under hösten 2025. Känner du igen dig? Läs vidare!* 




  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 I rollen som IT-support arbetar du med att hjälpa användare via telefon, e-post, portal och chatt. Ditt uppdrag är att skapa en smidig och positiv upplevelse för användaren – oavsett om det handlar om en enkel fråga eller ett tekniskt problem som kräver felsökning.
 



 Tillsammans med teamet bidrar du även till att utveckla och förbättra våra arbetssätt. Du kommer att arbeta enligt schema, vilket innebär både vardagar och helger.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att inkludera:** 



* Ge teknisk support till användare via flera kanaler
* Felsöka och åtgärda incidenter
* Dokumentera ärenden i vårt ärendehanteringssystem
* Bidra till ständiga förbättringar av processer
* Samarbeta nära teamet för att utvecklas tillsammans



  





**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid, 100 %
 



**Period:** 
 25 augusti – 28 november 2025
 



**Plats:** 
 Solna
 



**Arbetstid:** 
 Schemalagd, inklusive vardagar och helger
 



  





**Din profil** 




 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med IT-support eller kundservice, gärna i en miljö där tempot är högt och användarfokus är avgörande. Du trivs i dialogen med användaren, är lösningsorienterad och tycker om att ta ansvar.
 



  





 Du tillför värde till organisationen genom din goda kommunikationsförmåga, tekniska förståelse och vilja att lära dig mer. Vi tror att du är nyfiken, strukturerad och motiveras av att lösa problem – stora som små.
 



  





**Vi ser gärna att du har:** 



* Erfarenhet av användarsupport, IT-support eller kundservice
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska
* Ett stort teknikintresse och relevant utbildning inom IT
* Erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem som ServiceNow (meriterande)
* Retailbakgrund (meriterande)



  





**Om oss** 




 Talents by Inhouse rekryterar och hyr ut personer i början av sin karriär oavsett bransch eller inriktning. Exempel på områden är inköp, teknik, Office Management, kundservice och administration.
 



  





 Våra konsulter är väldigt viktiga för oss och vi lägger stort fokus vid att våra konsulter ska känna att dom utvecklas hos oss. Därför erbjuder vi bland annat återkommande dialoger kring nästa utvecklingssteg, konsultaktiviteter, som till exempel frukostträffar, och en närvarande Konsultchef.
 



  





 Talents by Inhouse tillhör Inhouse som är ett konsultföretag inom organisationsutveckling, rekrytering och bemanning mot branscher inom kommunikation, ekonomi, chefsassistent, företagstjänster och HR.
 



  





**Övrigt/Vad händer nu?** 




 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du blir anställd hos Talents By Inhouse och arbetar ute hos vår kund. Du kommer att utgå från företagets kontor i Solna.
 



  





 Vi rekommenderar att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, då urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vi tar inte emot några ansökningar via mejl, utan du söker enkelt med ditt CV eller Linkedinprofil. Du ska inte skicka med något personligt brev, vi vet att ditt CV räcker gott och väl. För mer information eller frågor om testerna kontakta ida.hogberg@inhouse.se. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan.

title: Global IT Project Manager
company_industry: Paper and Forest Product Manufacturing and Packaging and Containers Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
 At Billerud we believe that when we have tomorrow in mind, we will do our very best today. It is thanks to our employees that we are a world-leading company within the field of renewable paper and packaging materials. Do you want to realize your true value and work for a sustainable tomorrow? Join us!
   

  

**We are looking for a Global IT Project Manager**
 Billerud has an ambitious strategy for the coming years, requiring large-scale transformation across the business. The IT Governance team plays a crucial role in this transformation by providing the structure, methods, and expertise to ensure that the changes are planned and delivered at the right time.
   

  

 The change agenda is driving a demand for professional project management competence, structured in a small Portfolio and Project Management Office (PMO) team consisting of project managers, portfolio, and project support. For this team we are looking for a Global IT Project Manager.
   

  

 In this role you will act as a specialist in project management and lead prioritized projects and programs within Billerud’s Project Portfolio. Additionally, you will be an ambassador and coach for project, program, and portfolio management processes and governance within the Global IT function and across Billerud.
   

  

**Your Main Tasks Will Be**
* Project Manager
+ Lead and manage business change projects from initiation to handover, ensuring alignment with business objectives and strategic goals from project idea to implementation and closure.
+ Support project requesters to define project scope, project business cases and other requirements to secure that the projects follow the Portfolio governance and approval process.
+ Develop project plans with timelines, budgets, and resource needs. Coordinate cross-functional teams to ensure successful delivery, monitor progress to identify and mitigate risks, and communicate status updates and issues to stakeholders/senior management.
+ Manage project documentation.
+ Ensure adherence to project management methodologies and best practices.
+ Facilitate project meetings, workshops, and presentations.

* Portfolio and Project Management ambassador
+ Be an ambassador for Portfolio and Project Management by supporting the IT Governance team in improving project management methods and promoting their adoption.
+ Coach projects beyond direct management to ensure adherence to processes, and support in leading workshops, meetings, and communications to share knowledge and best practices.


 You are a part of the Global IT Governance function and reports to the Manager Global IT Portfolio and PMO. The position is preferably based at our HQ in Solna but can also be based at our mills in Gruvön, Skärblacka, Gävle, Frövi or Karlsborg (Kalix). The role will require some travel.
   

  

 At Billerud, we put Safety First. Together we take great pride in our responsibility to contribute to a safe work environment. Please read more about our Safety First initiative
   

  

**Qualifications**
**To succeed in this position, we believe you have:**
* University Degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
* Solid Project Management experience (ideally with IT elements) as a Project Manager, or from a PMO or similar function.
* Experience in supporting project management training and governance, enhancing the company's project management skills.
* Experience in leading people within project environments.
* Experience of project management methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall) and how to apply them.
* Proficiency in project management software and tools (e.g., Planner, Microsoft Project, JIRA).
* Fluency in English (oral and written) is required; Swedish is a plus.


**Meritorious**
* Experience from the Manufacturing industry.
* Certifications in project management like Prince2, PMP, ITIL.


**Personal qualities**
 For us, personality is important. To succeed in this position, we believe you are business oriented with the ability to shift between the strategic agenda and operative tasks. You have a process-oriented mindset with ability to take initiatives and lead projects forward, while effectively influencing and inspiring others on different levels. You are results-oriented with a natural talent for planning and organizing your work, having attention to details. Collaboration is one of your key strengths, with high ability to lead effective group sessions. You are an exceptional problem solver with the flexibility to adapt to changes and new challenges.
   

  

 Our values are central in our business and we believe that you recognize yourself in: We care for each other and We do what we say!
   

  

**Contact**
 If you want to know more about the role you are welcome to contact Helen Campbell, recruiting Manager, Manager Global IT Portfolio and PMO, helen.campbell@billerud.com
   

  

 If you want to know more about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact Alice Lundberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, alice.lundberg@billerud.com
   

  

 Please note that response times may be longer than usual due to the vacation period.
   

  

**Application information**
 We are happy to receive your application no later than 17th of August.
   

  

 Billerud is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
   

  

**Why us?**
* Want to be part a key player in a newly created global IT organization?
* An opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable future.
* Development and career opportunities.
* Performance-based bonus, occupational pension and a number of different benefits according to company policy.
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard.


 Our recruitment process will contain: Interviews, recruitment test, references, alcohol- & drug tests and background check.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 43.5 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Solution Specialist
description:
We continuously seek more Solution Specialists with high social skills and an entrepreneurial mindset who want to develop alongside us on our ongoing growth journey!
   

  

 This job listing is open-ended, and recruitment for the position occurs on a periodic basis.
   

  

**Planacy is looking for you – a skilful solution specialist!**
 We are a highly ambitious SaaS company that’s in an exciting phase of expansion. We have developed a powerful platform and, with it, taken the position as the leading platform for data-driven budgeting, forecasting and planning on the Swedish market. Our software both simplifies and streamlines more value-creating processes which contributes to better-planned and more successful companies.
   

  

 With near 200 customers, including Trustly, Rejlers, Billogram, Foodora, Fjällräven and Vitamin Well, we have demonstrated the value that our product can deliver. Now it's time to scale up!
   

  

 Sweden is our home turf, Scandinavia our market – but a category leading position in north of Europe is our goal. Now we are searching for you who, together with a motivated, competent and committed team, wants to be part of the journey to realise our vision: to contribute to more data-driven, better-planned and more successful companies as the ultimate ally for the modern FP&A.
   

  

****The specialist with passion****
**Who are you?**
 You probably have a couple of years’ of experience from a background as a consultant within ERP, business intelligence, performance management, or finance reporting. You’re an inquisitive problem solver who has a passion for working with customers and delivering well thought out technical solutions. At the same time, you are curious, like to take initiative and want to be part of an entrepreneurial team. At Planacy, you’ll have great opportunities to develop both your technical knowledge and knowledge within performance management, while your curiosity and interest in problem solving are given plenty of scope.
   

  

**About The Role**
 At Planacy, you’ll work with a leading product. You’ll be the specialist who, together with your team, helps our customers to design optimal budgeting and forecasting processes, and who helps them to obtain as much value as possible from the platform. The role is very social and your technical interests will play an important part. As part of our Customer Team, you’ll have a significant role as the technical specialist who ensures that what we deliver is of the highest quality with a great customer satisfaction. With the insights you gather, and in close dialogue with our product development team, you’ll also have the opportunity to influence the development of the product going forward.
   

  

 As part of the team, it’s mainly your passion, self-leadership and motivation that influence your development. You’ll gradually gain in-depth knowledge of our platform and data-driven financial management. You’ll also have great opportunities to grow alongside the company on its exciting growth-journey.
   

  

**You're**
* A problem solver
* A team player with good self-leadership skills
* Probably a background as a techy consultant
* Structured and thorough with a business mindset
* Communicative and educational


**Background/Skills**
* Degree in Engineering, Information Technology, Business, or a related field
* Previous experience of client-oriented roles
* Fluent in written and spoken English & Swedish


**We offer a flexible work environment and good employment conditions**
 At Planacy, all employees play a key role and have a significant impact on the product and the company’s development. We have a passion for what we do. We have fun together and celebrate our success with shuffleboard, bubbles, burgers and a well-stocked beer fridge – as well as with a week-long annual Take Off to a pleasant destination (usually in southern Europe).
   

  

 We are convinced that if the team – that makes our success possible – continuously evolves and are happy and healthy, the success will be all the greater. We therefore offer a high level of trust and we value commitment and a high level of responsibility.
   

  

**We also offer:**
* Flexible work environment 🕐
* Both fixed and variable salary 💰
* 6 weeks of vacation 🏄🏻‍♀️
* A very good retirement plan 👵🏼
* Comprehensive health insurance 💙
* Annually one week team Take Off 🏖 🕺
* + additional benefits


 The role is based at our brand new office in central Stockholm but we offer a lot of freedom under responsibility – we love the atmosphere in our office but part-time remote work is possible.
   

  

 Of course you should join Team Planacy's continued growth-journey as our next Solution Specialist!

title: IT Service Manager – IAM
description:
We are seeking a
 **Temporary IAM Service Manager** 
 to support and strengthen our Identity and Access Management (IAM) capabilities. This consultancy assignment will focus on overseeing IAM service operations, managing vendor relationships, and ensuring the stability and performance of identity services across the organization.
   

  

**Start: 2025-09-01**
**End: 2025-12-31**
**Location: Stockholm, min 2 days/week onsite**
**Scope of Assignment**
 The consultant will be directly involved in the operational management of IAM services, with a strong focus on
 **Microsoft Entra, Active Directory** 
 , and other identity platforms. The role requires close collaboration with internal stakeholders, external vendors, and service teams to ensure IAM services are delivered effectively, securely, and in alignment with business requirements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Oversee daily IAM service operations and ensure service stability.
* Manage and coordinate with external IAM service providers, ensuring agreed SLAs and KPIs are consistently met.
* Provide hands-on expertise in Microsoft Entra ID, Active Directory, AD FS, and AD-Connect.
* Drive and support incident, problem, and change management processes.
* Act as a key liaison between technical teams, business stakeholders, and external partners.
* Monitor and report on IAM service performance, identifying areas for improvement.
* Ensure IAM processes and operations support security and regulatory compliance requirements.


**Required Competencies**
* Proven hands-on experience with Microsoft Entra ID, Active Directory, AD FS, and AD-Connect.
* Strong background in IT service management, including incident, problem, and change management.
* Demonstrated vendor management skills and experience working with outsourced IAM service providers.
* Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, with the ability to present technical and service performance updates to non-technical audiences.
* Solid understanding of IAM’s role in cybersecurity and compliance frameworks.
* Fluency in English and Swedish

title: Business Controller to H&M Assortment
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 H&M Assortment is where we design and develop our fashion collections for a wide variety of customers all over the world. At Assortment you will be a part of a mixed team consisting of designers, pattern makers, product developers and planners, all working together to create the best customer offer while at the same time influencing H&M on a global scale. Sounds like fun? It is!
   

  

 We aim to become industry leaders in creating irresistible products & assortment and are building a fast-moving & creative organization that is centered around the product. We want to build a trusted fashion brand and democratize sustainable fashion.
   

  

 As a Business Controller, you will play a key role in generating sustainable sales growth and profitability for your area of responsibility both short- and long term. Through surrounding analyses and fashion forecast, this role will enable a current and commercial assortment. Together with your team, you will lead the development of our global assortment by generating growth, profitability, and customer value to optimize each region and ensure a locally relevant assortment.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Optimize sustainable sales growth and profitability with the right quantity, the right timing, at the right place and at the best price.
* Take business-minded decisions and implement actions based on commercial analyses on sales, customer behaviour, and market trends.
* Take informal leadership responsibility, communicate insights in a clear, inspiring, and simple way. Mentor and lead your team towards our purpose and set goals.
* Participate in defining vision, strategy, goals and timeline together with the team leader.
* Support the team with buying follow-up securing the right assortment mix and volumes.
* Perform ongoing sales analysis and identify future potential and risk
* Take responsibility for the controlling and secure the balance between top-down vs. bottom-up perspective.


**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with:*
* A degree in business, engineering or equivalent area
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to turn your analysis into actions
* Leadership ability and a strategic mindset
* Salesmanship and the ability to identify what our customers want
* Experience within e-commerce is meritorious
* Great communication skills
* Fluent in English, both written and verbally


*And people who are:*
* Naturally curious mindset and constantly looking for possibilities to develop new growth and more efficient ways of working
* Working strategically and will enjoy developing our business as well as working hands-on analysing numbers
* Communicating with impact and seeing patterns in our data
* Engaging team player and self-motivated to drive goals and thrive in an entrepreneurial setting


**JOIN US**
 This is a fulltime position based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden reporting to Assortment Controllers. You don’t have to live in Sweden already, we welcome applications from all parts of the world and offer relocation support if needed.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your CV in English as soon as possible but latest by 29th August. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound
* In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP


 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.

title: Director of Operations
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Type:** 
 Full-time
   

  

**Company:** 
 enginzyme
   

  

**Industry:** 
 Biotech/Deeptech
   

  

 At
 **enginzyme** 
 , we’re pioneering a new way of making chemicals — combining the power of enzymes with the efficiency of traditional process engineering. As we scale our platform and commercialize breakthrough solutions, we’re looking for a
 **Director of Operations** 
 to help us build a world-class organization.
   

  

 This is a
 **key leadership role** 
 reporting to the SLT, perfect for someone who thrives at the intersection of strategy and execution. You’ll lead internal operations, drive cross-functional delivery, and ensure we’re running as effectively as we’re innovating.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Act as the operational right hand to the CEO
* Lead business operations (planning, budgeting, compliance, procurement, IT, HR processes)
* Ensure effective coordination across teams (R&D, Regulatory, Supply Chain, Commercial)
* Own internal reporting (KPIs, OKRs), planning cycles, and delivery tracking
* Build systems and processes that enable scale, clarity, and accountability


**What We’re Looking For**
* 6+ years of experience in operations, program delivery, or strategic execution
* Strong track record in managing and scaling operations, preferably in manufacturing, or tech-heavy industry
* Excellent communicator with strong analytical and systems thinking skills
* Experience working cross-functionally in high-growth or regulated settings
* Able to manage and lead a multifunction team
* Fluent in English (we are a multinational team from 20+ countries)
* Proven negotiation skills a plus


**Why join us?**
* Work on breakthrough technology with real-world climate impact
* Help decarbonize key industries through practical innovation
* Join a fast-moving, collaborative stellar team shaping the future of industrial biotech
* Your work will directly influence our ability to scale, deliver, and make impact
* the company expects to grow significantly over the coming years, so will the stakeholders in their responsibilities

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
Nice to meet you! I’m Shweta Malhotra, a Talent Acquisition Partner at LeadDesk. Together with Guro Andersen, our VP Customer Success, we’re strengthening our team in Sweden. Our new team member will be working with Zisson products.
   

  

 A Customer Success Manager will play a pivotal role in fostering long-term customer relationships, driving customer satisfaction, and ensuring the success of our clients. The primary responsibility is to understand our customers' needs, provide exceptional support, and work proactively to help them achieve their goals through our products or services.
   

  

 The CSM will be new customers contact point, and will lead a new onboarding from order to delivered.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
* This is a pivotal role that will significantly influence the strategic direction of product offerings. You will play a key role in delivering complex products more systematically, faster, and with greater impact.
* You'll be at the forefront working closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment with our strategic vision.
* Opportunity to enhance your product management skills and advance your career in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* Flexible office hours and a hybrid work model: Enjoy a mix of remote and onsite work (3 days a week) at our Sweden office.
* Join a publicly listed SaaS company that develops its own technology and is committed to innovation.
* Experience a truly international work environment, collaborating with talented colleagues from 27 nationalities across 8 countries in a multicultural and diverse setting.


**What you can expect as** 
**a Customer Success Manager**
* Providing training and resources to help customers maximize the value of our products or services.
* Collaborating with customers to understand their unique goals, challenges, and requirements, and tailor solutions to meet their needs effectively.
* Identifying opportunities for upselling or cross-selling additional products or services that align with the customer's needs.
* Gathering feedback from customers to gain insights into their experiences and relay this feedback to internal teams for product/service improvement.
* Collaborating with customers to develop and execute success plans, outlining clear objectives, milestones, and KPIs to measure progress.


**Customer Relationship Management**
* Developing and maintaining strong, trust-based relationships with assigned customers, serving as their primary point of contact.


**Customer Onboarding**
* Guiding customers through the onboarding process, ensuring a smooth and successful transition to our products or services.
* Product Knowledge
* Develop a deep understanding of our products or services and stay up-to-date on updates, features, and best practices.
* Customer Training
* Needs Assessment
* Account Growth
* Customer Feedback
* Customer Success Planning


**This is where the match happens**
**Must-haves**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field (or equivalent work experience).
* Strong technical understanding and genuine interest in technology
* Proven experience in customer success, account management, or a related role.
* Ability to understand and communicate technical concepts.
* Fluent in Swedish and English; proficiency in Norwegian would be an advantage and considered a plus


**Practicalities (example, change as agreed)**
* Your location: Sweden Metropolitan area
* Work permit in Sweden
* Start date: As soon as possible
* Work model: Hybrid
* Working hours: Flexible
* Employment: Full-time and permanent


**What’s Next**
 We can’t wait to meet you! Apply today or
 **latest by 30th August'25**
 For more information, please reach out to Shweta Malhotra from the Talent team by email: ext-shweta.malhotra(at) leaddesk.com.
   

  

***LeadDesk briefly***
*At LeadDesk, our purpose is to simplify human connections between organisations and people across Europe. Every year, our AI-powered platform connects more than 500 million customers with call center agents.*
*When it comes to our employees, we believe that each of us is a Leader. Someone with a lot of ambition, drive, and readiness to take (and receive!) ownership from day 1.*
****We welcome people from all backgrounds and walks of life, which is reflected in our diverse community of Leaders. As an employer, we're committed to providing equal opportunity for all employees and applicants.****

title: Security Technician
description:
Job ID
   

  

 223090
   

  

 Posted
   

  

 15-Aug-2025
   

  

 Service line
   

  

 GWS Segment
   

  

 Role type
   

  

 Full-time
   

  

 Areas of Interest
   

  

 Engineering/Maintenance
   

  

 Location(s)
   

  

 Stockholm - Stockholms lan - Sweden
   

  

*Do you want to work at an international company in a role with good development opportunities? Are you structured, technically interested, communicative and thrive in a role where you are the spider in the web for security technical issues? Then you are the right person for the position as a Security Technician! Apply today as the selection is ongoing.*
 CBRE continues to grow and we are now looking for a Security Engineer for one of our largest client accounts with operations all over Sweden. You will be part of a close-knit team, which works closely together to offer our customer the best possible service. We also work with colleagues around the world, which makes for varied work.
   

  

 You will work in a team that focuses on optimizing and developing the technical and physical security for our customer. As a Security Engineer on this contract, you will work in a management role with high-tech security systems in a business with a high security profile. You are responsible, together with the team and subcontractors, for the development, operation, maintenance, service and troubleshooting of the company's security technical facilities such as lock and access control systems, alarms, IP-connected camera systems with image storage servers and overall IP-connected alarm communication systems.
   

  

**What You´ll Do**
* Monitoring and troubleshooting: Overseeing security systems to identify and fix any issues or security vulnerabilities.
* Security analysis: Conducting security analysis and risk assessments to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities.
* Documentation: Document all security measures and system changes carefully.
* Training and Support: Provide technical support and training to users of the security systems.


**What You´ll Need**
* Positive and curious to learn new things.
* Able to work independently and feel comfortable making decisions.
* Responsible, have good organizational skills, taking initiative when needed and good at completing tasks.
* Educational background in technology/IT or upper secondary education in technology/security/IT as well as relevant further education in one or more higher-level alarm systems, CCTV and IP networks.
* Work experience as a safety technician or equivalent work experience that is relevant.
* Good knowledge of Swedish and English, both in speech and writing.
* B driving licence.


 We value that you have a strong customer focus, are responsible and reliable. You feel good in an environment that is characterized by great commitment and where the ability to handle rapid changes and communicate those is of great importance.
   

  

 We offer you an exciting opportunity in a large global organization with great development opportunities. You will be covered by our occupational pension, our wellness benefits and our Benify portal, etc.
   

  

 The position is a full-time, permanent position with placement at our customer´s site in Kista. Travel may occur to other places in Sweden.
   

  

 Do you recognize yourself in the above description? Then we look forward to receiving your application. We are reviewing applications as they come in and the position may therefore be filled before the application deadline, 2025-08-28
   

  

*CBRE Group, Inc. is the world's largest commercial real estate and investment firm. At CBRE, our passion is to deliver market-leading real estate-related services that enable our clients to thrive! Our 130,000 employees serve real estate investors and property owners through more than 530 offices worldwide. Our services include facility management, transactions and project management; Property management; Investment management; Valuation and valuation Real estate leasing Strategic advice; Property sales; Mortgage services and development services.*

title: Systemtekniker/Systemingenjör - Mätning & Automation
description:
**Newsec erbjuder fastighetsägare, investerare och hyresgäster ett komplett utbud av tjänster inom tjänsteområdena Property Asset Management och Advisory.**
*Newsec grundades 1994 och är idag ett partnerägt företag med cirka 2 700 medarbetare fördelade över de sju nordiska och baltiska marknaderna. Newsec är Sveriges ledande fastighetsförvaltare. Vi har hög tillväxttakt och efterfrågan på våra tjänster ökar, vi rekryterar därför aktivt och behöver utöka vår verksamhet med* 
*en* 
*Systemtekniker/Systemingenjör – Mätning & Automation till Newsec Digital Solutions.
 *Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Vill du arbeta med framtidens fastighetsteknik?**
 Vi söker dig som har 1–2 års erfarenhet som installationstekniker inom el eller automation och som vill ta nästa steg i en miljö där teknik, innovation och hållbarhet möts. Hos oss får du arbeta med energimätning, sensorteknik, tekniska nätverk och fastighetsautomation – i en roll där du får växa med uppgiften.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
 Som systemtekniker hos oss kommer du att:
   

  

* Installera och konfigurera tekniska system inom Mätning, automation och sensorteknik
* Arbeta med tekniska nätverk, bussystem och digitala styrsystem (OT/IT)
* Delta i driftsättning och felsökning av systemlösningar
* Samarbeta med projektledare, konsulter och kunder i olika projekt
* Dokumentera installationer och bidra till teknisk kvalitet i leveranser


**Vi söker dig som har:**
* 1–2 års erfarenhet inom elinstallation eller automation
* God förståelse för tekniska system, gärna inom fastighetsteknik
* Intresse för digitala lösningar, OT/IT och tekniska nätverk
* Förmåga att läsa ritningar och arbeta strukturerat
* B-körkort (meriterande)


**Om Digital Solutions**
 Inom
 **Digital Solutions** 
 arbetar vi med tekniska koncept inom:
   

  

* Fastighetsenergimätning
* Fastighetsautomation
* Sensorteknik
* Driftövervakning


 Vi är ofta ansvariga utförare i våra leveranser, men vi ser ett växande behov av kompetens i de tidiga skedena – projektering, konstruktion och inventering. Därför söker vi dig som vill vara med och stärka vår kapacitet i dessa delar.
   

  

**Ditt framtida team**
 Du blir en del av ett engagerat team med 12 kollegor inom en större koncern med 2800 medarbetare. Vi har en stark kultur av samarbete, innovation och utveckling. Vår affär finns idag hos 30 fastighetsbolag med cirka 200 installationer årligen – och vi har ambitiösa planer på att expandera till fler marknader internationellt.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig:**
* En utvecklande roll i ett framtidsområde
* Möjlighet att arbeta med ny teknik och smarta lösningar
* Kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter inom koncernen
* Ett inkluderande team med hög teknisk kompetens


**Ansökan**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid med placering i Stockholm. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt att all kompetens på arbetsmarknaden tillvaratas. Vi välkomnar alla sökande och eftersträvar mångfald.
   

  

*På grund av GDPR tar vi ej emot din ansökan via mejl. Alla ansökningar behandlas konfidentiellt.*
 Läs gärna mer om oss på vår hemsida www.newsec.se, där hittar du även våra andra lediga tjänster och har dessutom möjlighet att Connecta med oss.

title: Service Management Lead
job_function: Business Development, General Business, and Strategy/Planning
description:
At Sandvik’s Mining business area, we’re building the digital backbone of our global operations—and we’re looking for a Service Management Lead to help us shape the future. If you’re passionate about service excellence, thrive on collaboration, and want to drive real impact across business and IT, this is your opportunity.
   

  

**Some Words About Us**
 We’re a global leader in mining and rock excavation, offering equipment, tools, service, and digital solutions that drive productivity and sustainability. As we continue our digital transformation, we’re investing in smarter service management practices that align IT with business outcomes—and that’s where you come in.
   

  

**About Your Job**
 In this role, you play a pivotal part in transforming how we manage and deliver both IT and business services across our organization. You lead the development of service portfolio management practices, define service models, and help establish clear service ownership across business and technical domains. You bring together service owners and key stakeholders to improve service mapping and ensure alignment between business needs and technical delivery. Your focus is on driving improvement, fostering collaboration, and enabling teams to enhance performance and deliver greater business value.
   

  

 You’re not just managing processes—you’re building a strong community of practice and cultivating a culture of continuous improvement. This is a strategic and hands-on role for someone who thrives in complex environments and is passionate about making a measurable impact.
   

  

 You’re based in one of our key locations – Stockholm, Tampere, or Dublin. You’ll work in a hybrid setup, with flexibility to collaborate across borders and time zones.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You bring experience in service management, ideally with hands-on knowledge of ServiceNow and ITSM frameworks. You understand the importance of stakeholder engagement, governance, and data integrity. A degree-level education is required, and you’re comfortable working across both business and technical domains.
   

  

 As a true connector and communicator, you know how to bring people together, align goals, and drive progress. You’re structured, strategic, and always looking for ways to improve. You believe that great service management is about people, not just processes—and you’re ready to lead the way.
   

  

**Our culture**
 At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.
   

  

**Contact information**
 For further information about this position, please contact Barry James, hiring manager, at barry.james@sandvik.com
   

  

 Please note that response times may be slightly longer during the summer months due to vacation periods. We appreciate your patience and wish you a wonderful summer!
   

  

 We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.
   

  

 Union contacts – Sweden
   

  

* Cecilia Mickelsson, Unionen, +46 (0)70-616 90 89
* Fredrik Andersson, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-266 78 50
* Olle Hansson, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-650 57 43


 Recruitment Specialist: Hanna Thomas
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Send your application no later than August 15, 2025. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0079349.
   

  

 As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline. Interviews are planned to start in week 34.
   

  

 To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.
   

  

*Mining is a business area within the Sandvik Group and a global leading supplier of equipment and tools, parts, service, digital solutions and sustainability-driving technologies for the mining and construction industries. Application areas include rock drilling, rock cutting, loading and hauling, tunneling and quarrying.* 
*In 2024, sales were approximately 63,6 billion SEK with about 17,000 employees.*

title: Copy Writer / Creative Strategist
description:
Hiya! 
 




  






 We’re Omoi. 
 




  






 We’re a creative agency who works with deep tech, space companies (yes, plural), luxury hotels, climate tech businesses, the occasional gaming studio, VCs, and more. Oh, yes, we also worked with an insanely cool chemistry startup in Paris. And sometimes we help Pharrell’s skincare company Humanrace. Our clients tend to be spread out all over the world. And that’s just the way we like it. We want to work with the most innovative and interesting companies of today and tomorrow.
 




  






 We help our clients with branding, pitch decks, brand films, websites, social content, and more. But what we really do is help them tell stories. Stories that grab people’s attention. 
 




  






 We’re now looking to supercharge these stories by adding someone who is a phenomenal copywriter and creative strategist to our team. 
 




  






 We need someone who writes in native-level English (we rarely have Swedish clients). Someone who can develop buttery smooth copy to explain highly technical and sometimes even esoteric subjects. You will ideally have spent some time at agencies refining your craft. An expert multitasker who thrives in a hybrid, client-facing role that juggles both creative and analytical thinking.
 




  






 At Omoi you will help lead the onboarding and discovery process, interviewing founders and their stakeholders to get a clear understanding of the companies we work with and help set a creative strategy with the team. What makes this company unique? What makes it tick? What is the thing that we should focus on to make it shine? This is part research, part investigative journalism.
 




  






 You will then own all kinds of strategic and executional writing deliverables such as brand positioning/messaging pillars, tone of voice guidelines, brand manifestos, film scripts, taglines, pitch deck narratives, website copy decks, and more.
 




  






 Our ideal candidate is a good listener and knows how to communicate gracefully with both high-touch clients and other team members. You can both think of the big picture and dive into the details. You have a special way with words and an empathetic heart. You are proactive, obsessive over details, and you are not afraid to roll up your sleeves and be hands-on with tasks that fall outside your wheelhouse.
 




  






 That’s it really. 
 




  






 You’ll get to be part of an international team who have worked at companies like Bottega Veneta, Ogilvy & Mather NY, Gin Lane, Great Works, Laird & Partners, Collins, and more.
 




  





**Select Past & Current Clients:** 




  




* The Exploration Company
* EQT Ventures
* ZCG
* Syntetica.co
* Humanrace.com
* Fendi Casa
* The Climate Brick3



  





**Required Qualifications:** 




  




* 3+ years’ experience as a copywriter/brand strategist at a startup or creative agency
* Experience creating decks and leading client presentations
* Technically savvy and excited to learn new tools, processes, and subject matters
* Thrives in a fast-paced environment as part of a small team, wearing multiple hats
* Kind, respectful, and open-minded person with a positive mental attitude



  





**Bonus Qualifications** 




  




* Experience raising capital for startups, i.e. fundraising and pitching to investors



  





**Application** 




  




* Please send a resume with your background
* At least one example of a project you have owned from start to finish
* A brief letter explaining why you’re the right person for this job!



  






 This is a full time in-office position at our studio in central Stockholm.

title: Customer Experience Agent
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 As a Customer Experience Agent at Juni, you will be part of our CX team dedicated to delivering exceptional experiences to our customers. You’ll be the first point of contact for inbound inquiries, resolving issues with empathy, clarity, and speed. Delivering valuable customer feedback internally to our wider org, and working closely within the CS function. You’ll help shape how our customers perceive Juni every day. Your work will directly contribute to building trust and driving customer loyalty as we scale.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
 In this role, you’ll:
   

  

**Resolve Customer Inquiries**
* Manage all inbound support conversations via Intercom chat and support email.
* Triage and escalate urgent or high-risk issues, such as fraud or critical payment failures.


**Maintain Communication Standards**
* Deliver clear, consistent, and empathetic support in every interaction.
* Ensure all conversations are tagged with the correct types, subtypes, prior to closure.


**Drive Continuous Improvement**
* Surface recurring issues and feedback to Product/Engineering, Commercial, Leadership.
* Contribute to monthly reporting on CSAT trends, issue volumes, and SLA performance.


**Uphold SLAs and KPIs**
* First Response Time: Chat/Email varies depending on SLA (URGENT,HIGH,NORMAL,LOW)
* Resolution Time: Chat/Email varies depending on SLA (URGENT,HIGH,NORMAL,LOW)
* CSAT: >90% positive rating


**Weekend Coverage**
* Provide URGENT priority coverage during weekends and red days


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Intercom
* G-suite
* Slack
* Hubspot
* Notion


**Qualifications 👑**
***What we need to see***
* 1–3 years of experience in a customer support or CX role, ideally in fintech, SaaS, or fast-growing digital products.
* Proven track record of meeting SLAs and high CSAT scores.
* Excellent written and verbal Swedish and English communication.
* Comfort handling sensitive or high-risk scenarios (e.g., fraud, payment issues).


**What We’d Love To See**
* Experience working with Intercom.
* Familiarity with basic accounting or financial services concepts.
* Experience contributing to support process improvements or knowledge base content.


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days. Awesome.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Experienced Business Analyst within Sanctions & Screening to Financial Crime Prevention | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Welcome to the world of combating financial crime through the lens of data analysis and strategic insights!
   

  

 We are thrilled to announce that we have an open position within SEB’s Group Sanctions Office, namely the role of Business Analyst in our Sanctions & Screening team.
   

  

 This role can be based in either Stockholm or Riga.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be working with both name and transaction screening with a focus on sanctions, adverse media and PEP. As a Business Analyst you will be expected to guide the entire SEB Group and ensure that our screening tools are fit for purpose, and critically efficient and effective.
   

  

 Our new team member will play a key role in SEB’s agile environment where you will support the PI planning process, help refine features, coordinate activities and analyze data in close collaboration with our Product Owner(s).
   

  

 You will also be involved in various assignments to strengthen the bank’s screening capabilities and ways-of-working across the SEB Group.
   

  

 The right candidate will report into the Group Head of Screening.
   

  

**As a Business Analyst, You Will Be Responsible For**
* Acting as an SME in various initiatives, working closely with colleagues from across SEB’s Financial Crime Prevention division and other business teams.
* Harvesting and analyzing data to help finetune and better calibrate our screening tools
* Driving change in an agile environment in close collaboration with Product Owner(s)
* Collecting business needs and translating them into business and IT requirements
* Supporting the model risk management and model validation process
* Performing tasks in close collaboration with wider Group Sanctions Office colleagues
* Building relationships across SEB’s divisions (Corporate & Investment Banking, Business & Retail Banking, Wealth and Asset Management) globally


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* 5+ years of experience working with Financial Crime Prevention from either banking or consulting
