title: Sr Growth Engineer ( Fullstack TS/Vue/NodeJS)
description:
n8n is a workflow automation platform that uniquely combines AI capabilities with business process automation. We give technical teams the flexibility of code with the speed of no-code, backed by a passionate community of builders. With 500+ integrations and fair-code principles, we're revolutionizing how businesses connect their systems and processes.


We were founded end of 2019 and currently:


* We’re a diverse team of + 120 talented people
* Our annual recurring revenue is growing over 7x year-over-year
* ️ With +118k GitHub stars, we are in the top 50 most popular projects of all time on Github
* We were the 25th fastest growing startup last year and 4th BtoB SaaS Rising 100 this year in Europe according to Sifted
* We were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured our $60M Series B (February '25, led by Highland)

**Missions**


As a **Senior Engineer on our new Growth team**, your mission would be to build and iterate on features and systems that drive user acquisition, activation, and retention - ultimately accelerating n8n’s self-serve growth engine.


This is a unique opportunity to be among the founding engineers on a high-impact team where you’ll collaborate closely with product, design, marketing, and engineering peers to improve the entire Cloud user journey - from sign-up to subscription.

 **What You’ll Do**

**Improve and maintain growth-critical features** – You’ll take ownership of flows like signup, onboarding, and the admin dashboard to ensure a smooth, performant experience for every new user

**Ship high-impact experiments** – You’ll design, build, and A/B test new features to increase conversion and retention — think upgrade flows, contextual prompts, or new pricing nudges

**Scale our growth systems** – You’ll help build and optimize services to enable user growth at scale, like in-app messaging platforms, billing systems, and email orchestration tools

**Drive measurable business outcomes -** Your work will directly contribute to n8n’s ARR, user retention, and growth KPIs. You'll track performance, identify areas to improve, and ship iteratively to increase activation and retention

 **Projects You Might Tackle**

* Adding social login and personalization to our signup flow to optimise the sign-up funnel
* Create new onboarding experiences to help users see n8n in action fast
* Building new upgrade and downgrade flows to optimize conversion and retention
* Building an in-app notification platform to push and orchestrate messages to users

**Requirements**
----------------

**Who You Are & What You’ll Bring**

* **5+ years of full-stack engineering experience** with **TypeScript/JavaScript**, **Node.js**, and **Vue** or **React** (plus HTML/CSS/UI libraries)
* Experience building **user-facing SaaS products** end-to-end in a start-up environment
* **Product mindedness**: you deeply care about the user experience and business impact
* **Comfort with ambiguity:** You don’t wait for perfect specs, designs, or ideal conditions. You move forward with what’s available and iterate quickly. You know when to ship a fast MVP and when to design for scale.
* **Speed + ownership mindset:** You move fast but responsibly, understanding that experimentation and velocity are core to unlocking growth.

 **Nice-to-have**

* Past experience as a founder or early-stage startup engineer
* Data fluency – You know how to interpret metrics and make decisions based on user behavior and experiments.
* Experience with CI pipelines, cloud deployments, or DevOps tooling
* Exposure to pricing strategy, funnel optimization, or revenue KPIs

**Interested in learning more about our engineering teams?**  

Check out our different teams to get a better understanding of what they do: Discover Engineering at n8n. Please check all our engineering openings and apply to the team that feels like the best fit for you.

*n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.*

*We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.*

***Our company language is English.***

*You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our* *Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n* *(**https://www.notion.so/n8n/Diversity-inclusion-and-belonging-n8n-c1bec2fff536422d868b1a438d990e35**).*

***Location disclaimer:*** *If you see multiple job postings for the same role, it is most likely because we're hiring remotely for this role and posting in different locations to make sure every potential candidate can see the role. Please apply to the location you're the most likely to work from in the future.*

**Benefits**
------------

* **Competitive compensation** – We offer fair and attractive pay.
* **Ownership** – Our core value is to “empower others,” and we mean it—you’ll get a slice of n8n with equity.
* **Work/life balance** – We work hard but ensure you have time to recharge:


	+ **Europe:** 30 days of vacation, plus public holidays wherever you are.
	+ **US:** 15 vacation days, 8 sick days, plus public holidays wherever you are.
* **Health & wellness** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide benefits according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** Comprehensive medical (PPO 1200), dental, and vision plans.
* **Future planning** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide pension contributions according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** 401(k) retirement plan.
* **Financial security** –


	+ **Europe:** We provide benefits according to local country norms.\*
	+ **US:** Short-term & long-term disability insurance, life & AD&D coverage, and additional hospital coverage.
* **Career growth** – We hire rising stars who grow with us! You’ll get €1K (or equivalent) per year to spend on courses, books, events, or coaching to level up your skills.
* **A passionate team** – We love our product, and we prove it with regular hackathons where we see who can build the coolest thing with it!
* **Remote-first** – Our team works remotely across Europe, with regular off-sites for team bonding. Some roles, like sales in the US, are hybrid—please check the job description.
* **Giving back** – We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.
* **Transparency** – We all know what everyone’s working on, how the company is doing—the whole shebang.
* **An ambitious but kind culture** – People love working here—our eNPS for 2024 is 94!
* *Country-specific details are provided in your contract.*

title: Power BI Admin
description:

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!  

  

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.

* Schedule tasks, such as data refreshes or content management, using automation.


Power BI core Data Modeling and Transformation:

* Utilize Power Query Editor to clean, shape, and transform data from various sources.
* Merge and append data tables to create unified datasets for reporting.
* Configure data refresh settings to keep datasets up to date with the latest data.
* Optimize data source connections for performance and efficiency.
* Define RLS roles and rules to restrict data access based on user roles or attributes.
* Test RLS configurations to ensure data security and access control.
* Generate compliance reports to monitor data usage, access patterns, and adherence to policies.
* Use audit logs to track user interactions with sensitive data.

  

 System Monitoring and Incident Response:

* Develop and manage monitoring tools and systems to track the health, performance, security, and availability of software applications, infrastructure components, and services.
* Set up alerts, dashboards, and metrics to proactively detect and respond to system outages, service disruptions, and performance incidents.
* Investigate and diagnose the root cause of incidents and work towards their resolution in a timely manner.

  

Continuous Improvement and Collaboration:

* Drive a culture of continuous improvement by identifying areas for automation, efficiency, and operational excellence.
* Document procedures, incidents, and best practices to facilitate knowledge sharing and improve team efficiency.
* Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to propose innovative solutions that enhance system reliability and performance.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and network engineers, to ensure smooth operation of systems.

 **Qualifications**  

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience) with 7+ years of IT experience.

* Strong Power BI Admin experience.
* Proficient in scripting/programming languages such as Python, Bash (Recommended).
* Experience with cloud platforms (Google Cloud Platform & Azure preferred).
* Experience in DevOps practice, CI/CD and monitoring tools.
* Experience with automation tools and configuration management frameworks such as Terraform, Puppet or Ansible (Recommended).
* Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
* Strong experience in system administration, infrastructure management, or site reliability engineering
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment and handle multiple priorities.

**Tech Stack (in a flash):**


Power BI (Fabric), Power BI Admin suite (Fabric), GCP, Azure, Python, Terraform, Git, SQL, Bash, Docker, PowerShell, ServiceNow, Atlassian.

 **Additional Information** **Place:** Remote

title: Azure Architect
description:
Azure Architect – Integration & D365 F&O Focus
  
We are now looking for a skilled Azure Architect for a long-term consulting assignment with our client in Stockholm. This is a critical role, where you will lead the architectural work around integrations in connection with a multi-market rollout of Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations.
  
About the assignment As an Azure Architect, you will be responsible for designing scalable, future-proof integration solutions between D365 F&O and other business-critical systems. You’ll collaborate closely with developers, product owners, and business stakeholders to ensure alignment between technical solutions and strategic goals.
  
While you’ll support the D365 implementation, the main focus will be on solution architecture and integration design, not hands-on configuration or development.
  
Example responsibilities
  
Design integration architecture between D365 F&O and external/internal systems
  
Utilize Azure services such as Logic Apps, API Management, Azure Functions, and Service Bus
  
Manage secure, high-performing APIs and data flows across systems
  
Support development teams with architectural guidance and technical decisions
  
Plan and optimize communication between systems to ensure performance and scalability
  
Use Azure DevOps for CI/CD pipelines, version control, and release management
  
Participate in integration testing and troubleshooting using Azure Portal and Postman
  
Collaborate with D365 experts to align technical solutions with business needs
  
  

Requirements
  
Solid experience as an Azure Architect in complex system landscapes
  
Proven track record designing integration solutions involving D365 Finance & Operations
  
  

**Strong proficiency in:**  

Azure Logic Apps
  
Azure Functions
  
API Management
  
Azure Key Vault
  
Azure Service Bus
  
Experience with Azure DevOps, CI/CD, and Git version control
  
Ability to translate business requirements into robust technical architecture
  
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work cross-functionally
  
  

Nice to have
  
Experience supporting D365 implementations from an architectural perspective
  
Microsoft certifications within Azure and/or D365 (recommended but not required)

title: Senior Azure Network Administrator
description:
*At Tetra Pak we commit to making food safe and available, everywhere; and we protect what's good – protecting food, protecting people, and protecting the planet. By doing so we touch millions of people's lives every day.*

*And we need people like you to make it happen.*


***We empower you to reach your potential with opportunities to make an impact to be proud of – for food, people and the planet.***

**Job Summary**
---------------



Global Information Management (Global IM) supports the Tetra Pak Group with all aspects of Information Management. We set the information management strategy and standards and work together with Tetra Pak’s Global Process Owners to automate our business processes making sure we run projects & services that provide the greatest value for Tetra Pak and its Customers. Global IM has approx. 850 employees in four main sites: Chakan in India, Lund in Sweden, Denton in the USA and in Singapore.



Innovation is at the core of everything we do at Tetra Pak and strengthens our commitment to making food safe and available, everywhere.

  



This is a permanent position based in **Lund, Sweden.**

**What you will do**
--------------------



As a part of our Network Product team we’re looking for a highly skilled Senior Network Engineer to join our team and work with the design, implementation, and optimization of our enterprise network infrastructure—we also looking into a personality with a strong emphasis on Microsoft Azure networking. You will be designing and setup the network within cloud management. You will get to communicate with stakeholders and help them with the network configuration and guidance we believe in strong technical skillset as we maintain and manage our network ourselves.

  


You will have the opportunity to work with colleagues from different parts of the world.

**We believe you have**
-----------------------



Technical Skills & Expertise

  


* + Architect and maintain secure, scalable, and high-performance network solutions across on-premises and cloud environments.
	+ Design and implement Azure networking components including VNets, NSGs, Azure Firewall, VPN Gateway, ExpressRoute, and Load Balancers.
	+ Monitor and troubleshoot network performance and security issues.
	+ Collaborate with cloud architects, security teams, and DevOps engineers to ensure seamless integration and compliance.
	+ Document network configurations, procedures, and best practices.
	+ Experience in deploying cloud resources using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) e.g. Terraform, Ansible
	+ Identify potential threats and weaknesses of existing cloud infrastructure and conduct regular security assessments

  




Qualifications/Requirements


* + Minimum +7 years of managing IT infrastructure in enterprise environments
	+ Good to have 2+ years of experience in implementing IaC, Kubernetes and CI/CD pipelines

  




Desired Characteristics


* + Traditional network experience
	+ Experience working in Agile & DevOps environments
	+ Experience in managing complex cloud infrastructure is a plus
	+ Passion for taking initiative and eager to learn and develop their cloud/DevOps skills
	+ Team player and comfortable conducting knowledge transfer sessions within the team and with stakeholders
**We Offer You**


* A variety of exciting challenges with ample opportunities for development and training in a truly global landscape
* A culture that pioneers a spirit of innovation where our industry experts drive visible results
* An equal opportunity employment experience that values diversity and inclusion
* Market competitive compensation and benefits with flexible working arrangements

  


**Apply Now**



If you are inspired to be part of our promise to protect what’s good; for food, people, and the planet, apply through our careers page at https://jobs.tetrapak.com/.



To find out more about how it is to work at Tetra Pak in Lund, take a look at the following website: Tetra Pak - We are Tetra Pak



This job posting expires on **2025-08-31.**  

To know more about the position contact Malcolm Fraser at +46 46 36 2897  

Questions about your application contact Josephine Malalla at +46 46 36 5253  

For trade union information contact Sveriges Ingenjörer Lars Haraldsson at +46 46 36 2533 and Unionen Lisbeth Larsson at +46 46 36 2320

  


*Diversity, equity, and inclusion is an everyday part of how we work. We give people a place to belong and support to thrive, an environment where everyone can be comfortable being themselves and has equal opportunities to grow and succeed. We embrace difference, celebrate people for who they are, and for the diversity they bring that helps us better understand and connect with our customers and communities worldwide.*

title: Software engineer DevOps
company_industry: Banking, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
Are you driven to build, enhance and care for IT solutions?
   

  

 We are seeking a highly skilled Software Engineer with a DevOps mindset and a combination of system administration and database expertise. You will work across multiple disciplines – from designing and maintaining secure and efficient Windows Server/SQL Server environments, to developing data-driven applications and automation solutions.
   

  

 In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
   

  

* Design, implement, and maintain secure Windows Server and SQL Server environments, ensuring high availability, disaster recovery readiness, optimized performance and robust user access controls.
* Develop and maintain CICD automation tools, ETL pipelines, and business logic using GitHub actions, Python, SQL, and SSIS.
* Embrace the DevOps mindset, “you build it, you run it”, being part of design, development, testing, and taking care of daily operations, managing maintenance activities, troubleshooting connectivity and performance issues ensuring a good delivery quality.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, design solutions, and ensure applications are delivered on time and follow the bank's security and regulatory guidelines.
* Monitor and optimize performance of infrastructure and applications, proactively assess and improve system and application security staying ahead of emerging threats.
* Strong expertise in Windows Server administration and SQL Server database management.


 What is needed in this role:
   

  

* Experience developing with Python, SQL, and ETL design using SSIS.
* Good understanding of performance tuning, backup/restore strategies, network protocols, security, and Active Directory
* Familiarity with DevOps practices, CICD pipelines, Git, and tools like GitHub Actions or Jenkins.
* Working knowledge of SAFE and Agile principles.
* Fluent in English and Swedish.
* Relevant academic degree or equivalent experience
* Team player with strong problem-solving and communication skills.


 Additional skills:
   

  

* Knowledge of financial instruments and background from banking or insurance industry is a bonus.


 With us, you can experience:
   

  

* Personal and professional growth through self-leadership and continuous development.
* Meaningful work that positively impacts our workplace, our customers, and society.
* An open and collaborative culture that encourages cross-functional teamwork and provides networking opportunities.
* A supportive and inclusive environment that promotes a balanced and sustainable work-life, with flexible working conditions when suitable for the role.
* Benefits such as our share based reward program Eken, company pension plan, employee offer for banking products, health insurance.


 "Join our team and...
   

  

* work with talented and motivated colleagues with an open and positive mindset. We will offer you an intellectually challenging job opportunity in a dynamic environment with good opportunities for personal development and growth. You will be a key player in the team who takes initiative and is happy to participate and influence our future development.” Jerry Anderson, your future manager


 We look forward to receiving your application by 05.09.2025.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sundbyberg & Malmskillnadsgatan
   

  

**Recruiting manager:** 
 Jerry Anderson
   

  

 We want to inform you that the selection process may begin after the summer holidays.
   

  

*We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Devops Admin
description:
Din roll
   

  

 Som DevOps Administratör hos oss arbetar du som konsult och stöttar våra kunder med att bygga och förbättra deras DevOps-miljöer. Du ansvarar för att designa, administrera och optimera CI/CD-pipelines samtidigt som du skapar effektiva arbetsflöden i nära samarbete med utvecklingsteam. En viktig del av rollen är att hantera Git-repositorier och använda Infrastructure as Code (IaC) för att automatisera och förenkla processer.
   

  

 Du kommer också att arbeta med modern containerteknologi och orkestreringslösningar som säkerställer skalbara och hållbara system. Utöver det får du arbeta med monitorering, analys och optimering av prestanda för att kontinuerligt förbättra CI/CD-livscykeln.
   

  

 Med varierande projekt och uppdrag kommer du att få insikt i olika branscher och tekniska miljöer, vilket ger dig en unik möjlighet att utvecklas och bredda din kompetens.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* Mjukvaruutveckling och automation med Python.
* Administrera och optimera CI/CD-pipelines, med förståelse för arkitektur.
* Git repository management, Git workflows och branchingstrategier.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC) och att sätta upp pipelines med verktyg som exempelvis Terraform eller liknande.
* Konfigurationshantering med verktyg som Ansible, Puppet, Chef eller liknande.
* Containerlösningar som Docker och orkestrering med Kubernetes.
* Monitoreringslösningar samt typer av metrics användbara i CI/CD-flöden.
* God förståelse för grundläggande cloud concept.
* Du behöver vara flytande i engelska och svenska.


 Meriterande erfarenheter
   

  

 Det är extra meriterande om du:
   

  

* Har erfarenhet av Golang-programmering.
* Har arbetat med CI/CD-automationsflöden som inkluderat egen hårdvara, till exempel egengjorda testriggar.


 Varför Knowit?
   

  

 På Knowit Connectivity får du möjlighet att arbeta i en innovativ och lärande miljö där du kontinuerligt utvecklas. Vi kombinerar teknik och kreativitet för att skapa värde för våra kunder och samhället. Som konsult hos oss blir du en del av ett kompetent team som brinner för samarbete, delning av kunskap och att lösa spännande tekniska utmaningar.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss? Besök vår hemsida eller kontakta oss direkt!
   

  

 Låter detta som en roll för dig?
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bli en del av vårt team.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**DevOps Engineer** 




  





  





**The Role** 




  





  





 We are seeking a talented DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic Database Services (DBS) team. In this role, you will be responsible for architecting and developing automation solutions for our diverse database services. You will collaborate with a team of highly skilled professionals in a fast-paced environment, leveraging your automation and DevOps expertise to enhance our DBS offerings. We are looking for someone who is eager to apply their DevOps knowledge to improve automation across various databases, including Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Solace, Kafka, and AWS. While experience with these specific databases is not required, it is considered as a plus. A willingness to have a close collaboration within the team as well as learning and adapting is essential.
 



  





  





**Main responsibilities:** 




  





  




* Lead the automation efforts to deliver a scalable database environment
* Participate in the definition of the requirements on the infrastructure for the services DBS are responsible for
* Participate in tests and verification of new products within DBS responsibilities
* Collaborate to achieve common goals both within the team and across departments
* Keep up to date with new automation and infrastructure technologies
* Foster a culture of knowledge sharing and mentoring
* Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role.
* Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager.
* Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group.
* Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you.
* Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.



  





  





**Skills and Requirements** 




  





  




* Deep knowledge in building automation solution using Ansible, Python and Terraform – preferably 3+ year experience
* Experience in building scalable and distributed infrastructure
* It is an advantage if you have some knowledge in database administration, but not a requirement
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to contribute to architectural and tech management discussions
* Comfortable running workshops and training sessions
* Good at collaboration and both verbal and written communication.
* Development mindset focused on cost optimization and performance

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
Bankgirot har en unik ställning på Sveriges betalmarknad som nu genomgår den största transformationen i modern tid. Vår IT-organisation är i en tillväxtfas för att utveckla framtidssäkrade lösningar som följer internationell standard och regelverk. Samtidigt ser vi till att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar säkert och stabilt – varje dag. Nu söker vi en DevSecOps Egnineer till en växande del av organisationen i Stockholm.
 



  





 Arbetet med att utveckla framtidens betalinfrastruktur är i full gång och vi behöver dig som vill vara en del av resan. Som DevSecOps Engineer kommer du att spela en viktig roll i uppdraget att säkerställa framtidens betalinfrastruktur på ett teknikbolag där vi har ett stort hjärta för uppdraget – och varandra.
 



  





**Din roll** 




 Vi söker dig som vill vara med i starten av ett nytt DevSecOps-team på Bankgirot. Målet är att göra säker mjukvaruleverans till en naturlig del av vår utvecklingsprocess. Inte bara genom rätt verktyg och tekniska lösningar, utan också genom att stötta våra utvecklingsteam med kunskap och vägledning, och skapa förutsättningar för säker utveckling i praktiken. Fokus ligger på automatisering, säkerhet och effektivitet.
 



  





 Som DevSecOps Engineer arbetar du nära utvecklingsteamen, bygger CI/CD-flöden med säkerhet från start, utvecklar verktyg som stödjer våra DevSecOps-principer och ser till att vi uppfyller regulatoriska krav. Du kommer in i ett tidigt skede och får stort utrymme att påverka hur vi jobbar, både tekniskt och organisatoriskt.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 




 Du har arbetat med DevOps-principer i några år och trivs i en roll där teknik, säkerhet och samarbete möts. Du är lösningsorienterad, pragmatisk och nyfiken och vi tror du vill vara med och bygga upp något från grunden.
 



  





 Vi tror att du har erfarenhet av:
 


* CI/CD-verktyg som GitHub Actions, GitLab eller liknande
* Containerteknologier (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, Pulumi)
* Grundläggande säkerhetsprinciper
* Något eller några programmeringsspråk, t.ex. Java, Typescript eller Bash



  





 Har du även erfarenhet av molnplattformar, transaktionstunga system eller reglerad miljö (t.ex. finans) är det ett plus.
 



  





**Intresserad?** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Bankgirot med Ants Tech Recruiters. Vid frågor eller funderingar, kontakta Rebecka Sundqvist på rebecka.sundqvist@ants.se eller +4673 596 51 98.
 



 Urval sker löpande, så tveka inte att ansöka redan idag. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning baserad i Liljeholmen i Stockholm. Du behöver ha goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska. Innan anställning beslutas genomförs en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) om tjänsten innebär arbete med säkerhetsklassade uppgifter eller säkerhetskänslig verksamhet.
 



  





**Om Bankgirot** 




 Bankgirot är ett svenskt clearinghus och teknikbolag med över 60 års erfarenhet av att leverera finansiell infrastruktur till banker. I samverkan med betalsektorn ser vi till att privatpersoner och företag enkelt kan göra överföringar och betalningar. Bankgirot säkerställer att det nuvarande betalsystemet fungerar felfritt, samtidigt som vi utvecklar framtidssäkrade lösningar. Vi säkrar och utvecklar Sveriges betalningar. Läs mer på www.bankgirot.se

title: Expert IT Developer
description:
**Job ID: 30605**
 Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.
   

  

 We are looking for an Expert IT Developer who will lead the technical design and development of cross-functional, multi- platform application systems followed by timely execution. Possess key knowledge and take full operational responsibility for multiple systems within own area. Play a leading technical role for colleagues in Nordea as well as external partners securing a shared understanding and commitment to needed changes and strategic priorities.
   

  

 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We’re not just a bank; we’re a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
   

  

**About Our Team / Who We Are**
 Master Data Management (MDM) is the business owner and single point of contact for Customer & Counterparty Data, Master Data & Reference Data, External Data Hub.
   

  

 We build the bridge between business processes and data management. We focus on simplification and compliance by leverage a single trusted view of high-quality master data across all channels and in all business processes enabling digitalization and the future relationship bank of Nordea Group.
   

  

 MDM unit is application owner of the two enterprise wide Golden Sources named CCM (Customer & Counterparty Master) and RMD (Reference & Master Data), as well as the centralized repository for external data, External Data Hub.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
**Welcome to the Expert IT Developer in Master Data Management Technology Domain. Main responsibilities in this role:**
* Drive the system lifecycle management within own area as well as incident, problem and change management to ensure a robust, scalable and up-to date business environment
* Identify new possibilities and perform complex application programming activities to significantly improve business process within own area
* Manage the project delivery process according to requirements, quality, Nordea standards and timeliness to successfully deliver on target
* Keep track of the latest trends to learn from existing best practices in software development constantly ensuring professional development
* Hand over documentation and relevant knowledge to maintenance and operations enabling stable operations
* Provide technical vision and leadership and define best practice within own area of expertise to enhance technical capabilities and solutions
* Team up with Nordea colleagues, as well as external partners to facilitate agile application development processes to improve quality and time to market
* Drive and develop IT professional input to business case clarifying how to reduce risk, simplify and modernise our application portfolio ensuring TCO (total cost of ownership) focus


 The role is based in Sweden (Stockholm).
   

  

**Who You Are**
**Your background and skills include:**
* Ability to work independently in an organized and structured way, always have a good overview of the status and able to foresee any potential risk and dependencies in order to have good quality control
* A proactive attitude and are a great collaborator
* Experience within Master Data Management is a must
* Very good English communication skills


**What We Offer**
 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**People** 
 are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 24/08/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Head of MDM Tech Requirements Analysis & QA, Sebastian Wilczewski at sebastian.wilczewski @nordea.com.
   

  

 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

title: Backend Engineer (Go) - Matchmaking
description:
As a Backend Engineer at Embark you will be an integral part of a highly creative game team focused on building powerful and reusable infrastructure and backend components for our games.
   

  

 Here you will have the opportunity to take initiative and drive finding solutions to exciting challenges, building the services that power our games, making sure they scale and continuously improve on them.
   

  

 As our game is distributed between game client, game server and the cloud, you’ll work together with your team to figure out which parts of the problem to solve in which location. At Embark we believe in creating smaller teams of well-aligned experts that can be trusted to create games and keep them running.
   

  

 You will be working mainly on matchmaking, but also, data analytic, game client, backend service infrastructures, etc. Some of the technologies we use to make all of those are Go, C++, GCP, Bazel, Kubernetes, Grafana, Google Spanner.
   

  

 You do not need to have any experience from games or games studios to apply.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Collaborate and work closely with fellow software engineers and technical stakeholders
* Build and improve services, features and tools for game development
* Continuously improve our engineering practices
* Make sure your code adds a great amount of value to your colleagues


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* A passion for interactive experiences, games and new technologies
* A solid understanding of building and maintaining complex distributed systems with performance, optimization, and observability in mind
* Comfortable working across domains—backend services, data analytic, game clients, infrastructure and observability
* Comfortable with Go and modern backend tech
* The ability to be a great team player with good communication skills
* Interest in taking initiatives and driving finding solutions to exciting challenges
* Professional English communication skills


**Additionally, we think it would be a great bonus if you are**
* Familiar with Site Reliability Engineering practices and what it takes to keep services running smoothly around the clock


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
   

  

*If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "* 
*Open Application.* 
*"*

title: Lead Solution Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Mavenoid is the Intelligent Support Platform for products and devices. Our purpose-built technology delivers best-in-class customer support with intelligent troubleshooting and personalized remote support. Our product manufacturers and sellers provide genius-level customer support and realize brilliant cost savings.
   

  

 Having raised our Series B, we’re in an exciting phase of growth but are still small enough for each new person to have a big impact on the company as a whole. We were founded in Stockholm, Sweden, but now operate globally as a remote-first company, with team members located across Sweden, the United Kingdom, the United States, and more.
   

  

**The role**
 We’re looking for a Lead Solution Engineer to join our fast-growing SaaS startup. You’ll join and lead a lean, experienced Solutions Engineering team that support over 100 customers worldwide. As the Lead Solutions Engineer, you’ll take end-to-end ownership of customer integrations–from post-signature implementation to technical projects that drive adoption and long-term value.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to build the foundation for Solution Engineering in the region—partnering with Customer Success, clients, Sales Engineering, Product, and Account Managers to drive business growth.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Server as the primary technical point of contact for enterprise customers onboarding and beyond.
* Translate business requirements into technical solutions, working closely with Customer Success and Account Managers.
* Build, configure, and test integrations between Mavenoid and external systems–such as CRMs, CCaaS platforms, CMSs, and e-commerce systems.
* Lead technical discovery sessions to gather integration requirements.
* Troubleshoot and resolve integration issues, collaborating with both clients and our internal engineering teams.
* Provide clear technical documentation and guidance for internal and external stakeholders.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 5+ years experience with complex customer implementations and onboarding for enterprise customers (SaaS experience is required)
* Experience with CCaaS, UCaaS and/or conversational and voice AI are a big plus
* Solid understanding of HTTPS-based integrations, including REST and GraphQL APIs, and experience connecting with third-party systems.
* Familiarity with at least one programming language (e.g., TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Go). TypeScript is our core stack–experience is a plus, but willingness to learn is just as good.
* Experience working with enterprise platforms like Salesforce, HubSpot, and CMSs.
* Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Comfortable managing multiple projects and shifting priorities in a dynamic environment.
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build trust with both clients and internal teams.
* Self-starter mindset–comfortable operating with autonomy in a fast-paced environment.


**Our Core Values**
**Win as a Team** 
 - Teams are not just extensions of leaders, but are instead a composite of individuals, each with their own strengths. We need to work together in order to scale. And, it’s more fun this way!
   

  

**Teach & Be Taught** 
 - As a company, we believe that there is always a way to improve how you work, and therefore it is important to be consistently open to learning. Also, in a fast-growing company, roles & contexts shift, and it is important to be able to adjust. Teaching others is the flip side of that – it's a great way to build deeper understanding of the topics you teach, and also an important tool to scale the organization as you step into new roles and responsibilities.
   

  

**Cut out the B.S.** 
 - Get to the bottom of the issue and surface the information needed to make good decisions.
   

  

**Pick up the Pace** 
 - As a startup, our structural advantage is speed, but only if we act with urgency. Don’t leave for tomorrow what you can do today.
   

  

**Eyes on the Ball -** 
 Don’t get distracted from what is most important, right now. In a startup, there are a million different things that you can do in any situation, and it’s necessary to have a consistent focus over time on the things that have the highest impact.

title: Data Engineer – Cloud-Based Analytics & Modern Data Platforms
description:
Myndigheten söker en erfaren programledare för att stärka arbetet inom Kontrollområdet, där en ny programstruktur har föreslagits. Uppdraget innebär att driva och etablera det nybildade programmet samt stödja Portföljkontoret i att bygga upp myndighetens förmåga att hantera programformatet enligt de styrprocesser som gäller för organisationen.
   

  

 Som konsult kommer du att ta ansvar för att strukturera och driva programmet, bryta ned övergripande verksamhetsmål till hanterbara leveranser och delprojekt samt leda arbetet med att bygga upp en effektiv metodik för portföljhantering. Du kommer att samarbeta nära med interna teams och ledningsgrupper för att säkerställa att projekt och initiativ genomförs effektivt.
   

  

**Kravprofil**
* Kompetensnivå 4 (9–12 år).
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av programhantering inom stora och komplexa IT-organisationer, särskilt med agila metoder.
* Minst 12 års sammanlagd erfarenhet av att driva projekt med en budget på 10 miljoner kronor eller mer.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att bryta ned övergripande verksamhetsbehov till strukturerade leveranser och delprojekt.
* Har haft ansvar för ett Projektkontor/PMO i minst 5 år i en organisation med en systemutvecklingsavdelning på minst 100 personer.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av utvecklingsplanering på portföljnivå för större digitaliseringsinitiativ.
* Du måste kunna kommunicera på svenska i både tal och skrift.


**Meriterande Krav**
* Erfarenhet av projektmetodik som PPS eller liknande.
* Erfarenhet av Jira och Confluence.


**Uppdragets Detaljer**
* Stationeringsort: Solna.
* Start/slut + option: 2025-05-12 – 1 år + möjlighet till förlängning med 1 år.
* Omfattning: 100%.


 Det här uppdraget ger en unik möjlighet att vara med och forma och leda ett viktigt program inom myndigheten, med stort fokus på att bygga långsiktig förmåga för programhantering och portföljstyrning.
   

  

**Om Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Product Specialist
description:
**Job Description:**
**Product Specialist**
**About Us**
 Easit AB is a Swedish software company with first-class consulting within system and business development. With in-house developed products for Enterprise Service Management and Data Management, we deliver powerful solutions to large companies and businesses for both the private and public sector. We’re situated in Sundsvall Stockholm, in Sweden, and have appr. 40 employees.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 The product specialist creates, develops and implements work processes in our product Easit GO. The role can involve both permanent assignments with customers or shorter and parallel assignments in project form. The role works close to the customer, works proactively, and is a catalyst for ideas. The position is placed in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**ROLE RESPONSIBILTILES**
**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain long-term customer relationships
* Pay attention to customer needs and come up with solutions
* Configuration / adaptations in Easit GO
* Capture the customer's exact requirements in depth
* To run, facilitate and participate in workshops to find solution proposals for the customer
* Educate customers in the product Easit GO.


**Key Skills & Experience:**
* Proven previous experience as Product Specialist or similar
* Hold a degree or relevant qualification is desirable
* Excellent written and verbal communications skills, both in Swedish and in English
* Good understanding of technology and how it is applied in business
* A genuine IT interest
* Knowledge and experience within Microsoft programs, e.g.AD, Excel, Power BI and Azure
* Experience of working in processes
* ITIL certification is meritorious.


**Personal Attributes:**
* High degree of self-motivation
* Driven, High Energy and enthusiasm
* Honesty and integrity
* Strong customer service mindset
* Enjoys working in a team
* Be able to work independently.


**WHY JONAS SOFTWARE?**
* Be part of a dynamic and innovative global organisation.
* Competitive compensation and benefits package.
* Opportunities for career growth within our expansive portfolio.
* Join a collaborative environment that champions diversity, equity, and inclusion, creating a space where everyone can excel.


**What Our Employees Say About Us**
 See what our employees say about us in the highlights video from our Jonas Annual Business Awards 2023 https://www.jonassoftware.co.uk/insights and our ‘Every Person Matters’ video from our Jonas Annual Business Awards 2024 https://www.jonassoftware.co.uk/why-jonas/people-culture/
   

  

**Additional Information**
**LOCATION**
* Remote or Office/Hybrid (ability to travel, sometimes at short notice)
* The position is based in Solna, Sweden.


**Benefits**
* Private Health Insurance
* Health Benefit 5 000 SEK yearly
* Contribution to you home internet connection.
* Mobile phone with 15 GB internet connection and free calls.


**MUCH MORE THAN A BENEFIT**
* Internal Learning & Development programmes
* Internal Mentor programme
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and Mental Health First Aiders to support you
* Jonas Europe & Jonas Global networking events (JABAs, GROW, JSA). Join communities, build networks and collaborate with your colleagues across the Global Group.


**OUR DEIB COMMITMENT**
 Our people define us and, at Jonas, we believe that diversity in all its forms enriches our organisation and drives innovation. We actively seek to create an environment where all employees feel valued, heard, and empowered to contribute their best work. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected characteristic and are dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all. Come and be part of a team where your unique background and experiences are celebrated!
   

  

 We strongly encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds, including those from underrepresented groups such as women, ethnic minorities, people with disabilities, and LGBTQ+ individuals and we are committed to creating an interview and hiring process that is accessible and inclusive for everyone.
   

  

**FLEX WORKS CULTURE**
 Here at Jonas Software UK & Europe, we see flexibility as a game-changer. We truly believe that working flexibly together helps to increase our innovation, growth and productivity, as well as supports our employees’ wellbeing and helps to provide great places to work.
   

  

 For most roles, the following types of flexibility are usually possible: working location, number of hours/days worked, different start and finishing times, flexible lunch break arrangements, agreed core hours, flexible hours, an element of working from home.
   

  

 Many of our employees work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time. Please talk to us at interview about the flexibility you need. We can’t promise to give you exactly what you want, but we do promise not to judge you for asking.
   

  

**Business Unit:**
 Easit ESM
   

  

**Scheduled Weekly Hours:**
 40
   

  

**Number of Openings Available:**
 1
   

  

**Worker Type:**
 Regular
   

  

**Career Site:**
**More About Jonas Software:**
 Jonas Software is the leading provider of enterprise management software solutions to the Country and Golf Clubs, Foodservice, Construction, Fitness & Sports, Attractions, Salon & Spa, Education, Radiology/Laboratory Information Systems, and Product Licensing industries. Within these vertical markets, Jonas is made up of over 65 distinct brands, which are respected and leaders within their own domain.
   

  

 Jonas’ vision is to be the branded global leader across the aforementioned vertical markets and to be recognized by customers and respective industry stakeholders as the trusted provider of ‘Software for Life’ and as an ambassador for technology, product innovation, quality, and customer service.
   

  

 Jonas Software is the valued technology partner of over 60,000 customers worldwide in more than 30 countries. Jonas employs over 2,000 skilled individuals consisting of a cross-section of industry experts and technology professionals. Jonas is headquartered in Canada and also operates offices throughout North America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Australia New Zealand and Africa. Jonas is a 100% owned subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc., headquartered in Toronto and traded on the S&P/TSX 60.
   

  

**IS THIS YOU?**

title: Senior Azure Engineer
description:
Vi letar efter dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär inom Azure och trivs med att arbeta nära kund i lösningar som gör skillnad. På Innofactor jobbar vi med både privat och offentlig sektor, i uppdrag där du får använda hela din tekniska bredd – och samtidigt utvecklas vidare inom säkerhet, AI och automation.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som
 **Senior Azure Engineer** 
 kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i vårt team inom Cloud och Infrastruktur. Du arbetar i både nya och pågående uppdrag – ofta i teknikintensiva miljöer där vi bygger smarta, skalbara och säkra lösningar i Azure.
   

  

 ✅ Bygga, drifta och automatisera lösningar i Azure (App Services, VMs, Kubernetes, Logic Apps, Azure Functions)
   

  

 ✅ Säkra och optimera kunders molnmiljöer – inklusive nätverk, datalagring och databaser (Azure SQL, PostgreSQL, CosmosDB)
   

  

 ✅ Arbeta med Infrastructure as Code – främst Bicep och pipelines i Azure DevOps, ibland även PowerShell
   

  

 ✅ Implementera AI- och säkerhetslösningar för att förbättra våra kunders miljöer
   

  

 ✅ Ta teknisk lead i projekt – från design till implementation
   

  

 Du kan självklart jobba både hemifrån och från kontoret. Bor du i Stockholm ser vi gärna att du tittar in ibland.
   

  

**Det vi letar efter**
 ✅ Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att implementera eller förvalta lösningar i Azure
   

  

 ✅ God kunskap om Azure-nätverk – t.ex. VPN Gateway, VNET, ExpressRoute, WAF
   

  

 ✅ Vana vid Azure DevOps, PowerShell, Git och IaC (t.ex. Bicep eller Terraform)
   

  

 Vi tror att du är nyfiken, självgående och gillar att arbeta nära kund. Hos oss jobbar vi agilt, i team med mycket kompetens och stort eget ansvar – och vi hjälper varandra att lyckas.
   

  

 Saker som kan vara till hjälp, men som du inte behöver kunna från början:
   

  

 ➕ Erfarenhet av AI-tjänster i Azure
   

  

 ➕ Certifieringar som AZ-104, AZ-305 eller liknande
   

  

 ➕ Vana vid agila arbetssätt (Scrum, Kanban)
   

  

 Vad du får hos oss
   

  

 Du blir en viktig del av vårt Cloud-team – ett tight, kunnigt gäng med stort engagemang och stark Microsoft-koppling. Här får du arbeta med moderna tekniker, utveckla din kompetens och vara med och påverka både din roll och våra leveranser.
   

  

 Förmåner
   

  

* Kompetensutveckling
* Flexibelt arbete
* Kollegor som stöttar och delar med sig
* Akiviteter och nätverk


 Och du – sök redan idag, vi anställer löpande!
   

  

**Innofactor** 
 är den ledande drivkraften bakom den moderna digitala organisationen i Norden. Vi jobbar med över 1 000 kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor, har det bredaste lösningsutbudet och den starkaste Microsoft-kompetensen i regionen. Vi är cirka 550 specialister i Finland, Sverige, Danmark och Norge.
   

  

 👉 www.innofactor.com
   

  

 #PeopleFirst #AIDriven #BeTheRealYou

title: Applikationsnära DevOps-tekniker
description:
Svenska kraftnät är en nyckelaktör i energiomställningen. Vår IT-division växer för att möjliggöra en fördubblad elproduktion och en fossilfri framtid. Med den senaste tekniken ökar vi både infrastrukturens kapacitet och utvecklingstakten inom digitalisering och processer.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker DevOps-tekniker till en av enheterna för Balanseringsapplikationer som styr kraftnätet. Som DevOps-tekniker kommer du huvudsakligen att arbeta med systemförvaltning och vidareutveckling av applikationer. Detta inkluderar underhåll och övervakning av systemen. En viktig del av ditt arbete blir att driva och genomföra uppgraderingar samt förbättringar av systemen, med ett särskilt fokus på vidareutveckling för att möta framtida behov och utmaningar.
   

  

 Vi söker flera personer på olika nivåer, både nyexaminerade och seniora. Oavsett nivå kommer du att vara en del av ett team som arbetar för att säkerställa driften och utvecklingen av våra kritiska applikationer och tjänster. Vi erbjuder möjligheter till utveckling och specialisering inom dina intresseområden. Du kommer bland annat att jobba med moderna lösningar baserat på Open Shift och Kafka.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer innebära att:
   

  

* Hantera incidenter, problem och felsökningar i 2:a linjen, automatisera flöden och bidra till att förbättra teamets arbetssätt och rutiner. Ge stöd och support till interna och externa parter.
* Bistå vid teknisk kravspecificering och vara med i att ta fram nya lösningar och skapa integrationer mellan olika system och lösningar, för att effektivisera verksamheten och distributionen av elkraft i Norden.
* Arbeta med att skapa och underhålla automatiska byggtester, säkerhetsgranskningar och driftsättning av applikationer och tjänster i våra system.
* Samordna olika typer av tester samt genomföra delar av dem själv, tillsammans med verksamheten och våra säkerhets- och testspecialister.


 Rollen bidrar till en viktig del i utvecklingen av Sveriges kraftsystem genom aktiv förvaltning. Du ingår i ett agilt team bestående av systemansvariga, lösningsarkitekter, DevOps-tekniker och testare. Teamets främsta uppgift är att vidmakthålla befintligt system och att utveckla nya lösningar på den nordiska och europeiska balansmarknaden.
   

  

**Om dig**
**Skallkrav**
 För denna roll behöver du ha en god service- och samarbetsförmåga då rollen innefattar många interna och externa kontaktytor. Du har en analytisk förmåga och tycker om att lösa komplexa problem som ska gynna de strategiska målen. Arbetsbelastningen kan skifta och därför behöver du vara stabil och lugn i en växande och händelserik organisation. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Generellt för rollen vill vi att
   

  

* Du har en akademisk examen inom systemvetenskap, datavetenskap eller annan utbildning som Svenska kraftnät bedömer relevant.
* Du är kommunikativ och uttrycker dig väl på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


 För dig som är nyexaminerad vill vi att du har
   

  

* Praktisk erfarenhet av programmeringsarbete, problemlösning och problemanalys.
* God teknisk förståelse för systemutveckling och systemmiljöer


 För dig som har arbetslivserfarenhet vill vi att du har
   

  

* Något eller några års erfarenhet med system/applikationsförvaltning enligt ITIL, PM3 eller motsvarande ramverk/styrningsmodell med verksamhetskritiska system.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av operativsystemet Linux eller Unix.
* Erfarenhet av felsökning, test och vidareutveckling av integrationsgränssnitt.
* Praktisk erfarenhet inom ett par av följande områden: Java eller Python, samt XML och SQL.
* Vana att dokumentera.


 Det är
 **meriterande** 
 om du har arbetat med
   

  

* Systemintegration, RH Fuse, JMS eller Webservices
* Agila metoder (Scrum, SAFe, etc)
* Github/Gitlab, Kubernetes eller Docker containers
* DevOps


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Resor kan förekomma inom Norden
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 1 september 2025. Du kommer att få svara på ett antal frågor istället för personligt brev, därför behöver vi bara ditt CV.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning och beredskap kommer att ingå när du kommit in i rutinerna. Provanställning kan bli aktuellt.
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät


**Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta gärna**
* Rekryterande chef Per Lundblad, 072 560 15 01
* Ansvarig rekryterare Victoria Waltenberg, 010 350 90 45
* Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72
* Erica Midfjäll, ST, 010 475 87 31


 Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se. Under semestertider kan svarstiden kan vara något längre än vanligt.
   

  

 Jobba här – bli en viktig del av vår energiframtid | Svenska kraftnät
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare i samband med rekrytering, vi har upphandlade avtal som gäller för Svenska kraftnät som statlig myndighet.
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät kan det vara ett krav på svenskt medborgarskap i vissa befattningar. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Data Engineer
description:
We are seeking a Senior Data Engineering Consultant. The team builds the digital capabilities that support our finance function—ranging from invoice processing and budgeting to cost estimation for our manufactured products.
   

  

**This role focuses on two key areas:**
* Developing and maintaining our shared data platform (built on AWS S3, Snowflake, dbt, and Terraform) to ensure it meets the needs of our finance teams.
* Collaborating with finance analysts and stakeholders to define, design, and deliver high-quality, domain-aligned data products in line with data mesh principles. We are looking for someone excited to contribute to building a truly data-driven organization—one where autonomy, ownership, and collaboration across teams are key to success.


**What You'll Do**
* Enhance our shared data platform by improving capabilities such as temporal data handling, access control, ingestion pipelines, and developer experience.
* Co-design finance data products in close partnership with analysts and finance stakeholders—supporting both internal finance needs and broader organizational use.
* Ensure robust data ingestion from third-party systems, in collaboration with our backend engineering team.
* Champion data mesh principles by promoting decentralized ownership and interoperability of data products.


**What We're Looking For**
*Must-Haves:*
* Proven experience designing and implementing modern data architectures.
* Strong hands-on experience with: Data lakes (e.g. AWS S3), Data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake), dbt or similar
* Familiarity with data mesh principles and domain-oriented thinking.
* Experience working closely with stakeholders designing data products
* Proficiency with CI/CD pipelines
* Experience with Kotlin/Java for ingesting data from microservices and third-party sources
* Proficiency in Infrastructure as Code, preferably using Terraform.


*Nice-to-Haves:*
* Experience building and operating microservice-based architectures.
* Understanding of business architecture, especially information concept modeling


**Some soft qualities we value:**
* You are curious about new things, but always balancing new ideas towards existing wisdom.
* You appreciate diverse viewpoints when tackling challenges yet understands the significance of reaching a consensus and adhering to the established pattern for effective collaboration.
* You are passionate about what you are doing and have a genuine interest in delivering great solutions.
* You embody a service-oriented mindset, making yourself accessible to your business colleagues. Recognizing that value is substantiated when business needs are met.
* You communicate effortlessly both verbally and in writing with colleagues and external parties within completely different domains/areas of expertise.
* You possess the ability to analyze and break down a bigger problem into smaller, graspable parts.
* You appreciate the importance of understanding and connecting with the organization's mission, goals, and strategies.


**Start:**
 2025-08-26
   

  

**End:**
 2026-08-26

title: Performance Testspecialist
description:
*Vill du vara en nyckelperson i att säkerställa att våra IT-system och applikationer levererar hög prestanda och tillgänglighet? Som Performance Testspecialist* 
*hos oss får du en central roll i att bygga upp och vidareutveckla vårt ramverk för prestandatestning. Här får du möjlighet att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö med engagerade kollegor som strävar efter att skapa robusta och skalbara lösningar för framtiden.*
**Om jobbet**
 Som Performance Testspecialist inom prestandatestning får du en central roll i att säkerställa att våra IT-system och applikationer lever upp till högt ställda krav på prestanda och tillgänglighet. Rollen innebär att du arbetar i en dynamisk och komplex miljö där du bidrar till att bygga upp och vidareutveckla vårt arbete med prestandatestning. Du samarbetar nära utvecklingsteam och andra intressenter för att skapa robusta och skalbara lösningar som möter verksamhetens behov.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Utforma och genomföra omfattande prestandatester end-to-end.
* Bygga upp och vidareutveckla ett gemensamt ramverk för prestandatestning.
* Samarbeta med utvecklingsteam för att integrera prestandatester tidigt i utvecklingsprocessen.
* Identifiera flaskhalsar och analysera svarstider, resursanvändning och andra prestandametriker.
* Stödja och coacha team i att utföra egna prestandatester.
* Bidra till CI/CD-pipelines med automatiserade prestandatester.
* Delta i kapacitetsplanering och utvärdera testmiljöer.


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av prestanda- och lasttestverktyg såsom LoadRunner, JMeter, K6 eller NeoLoad.
* Kunskap om olika testtyper: load-, stress-, soak-, spike- och capacity testing.
* Förmåga att analysera loggar, metriker och skapa tydliga rapporter.
* Erfarenhet av testautomatisering och CI/CD-integrering (t.ex. Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps).
* Grundläggande kunskaper inom nätverk, databaser, cachelösningar, containrar och operativsystem.
* Erfarenhet av observability-verktyg och logghantering (t.ex. ELK, Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana).
* Erfarenhet av prestandamätning och optimering i OpenShift/Kubernetes-miljöer.


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att etablera teststrategier och ramverk för prestandatestning.
* Aktivt arbetat med "shift-left" och samverkan med utvecklingsteam för tidig testning.
* Erfarenhet av NeoLoad och dess tillhörande verktyg (NeoLoad Web, NeoLoad Cloud, NeoLoad as-code).
* Kunskap om APM-verktyg som Dynatrace, Jaeger eller AppDynamics.
* Erfarenhet av scriptutveckling i Python, JavaScript, Groovy eller Bash.
* Erfarenhet från reglerade branscher som bank, finans eller offentlig sektor.


 Som person är du analytisk och noggrann med en känsla för detaljer. Du har en god förmåga att arbeta strukturerat med komplexa system och är en stark kommunikatör på både svenska och engelska. Du är självgående men också en lagspelare som trivs med att samarbeta med andra. Med ditt driv och din lösningsorienterade inställning tar du initiativ och driver arbetet framåt.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Du blir en del av ett team som ansvarar för krav, DevSecOps, test, release och utvecklingsverktyg för Länsförsäkringar Bank. Vi har högt i tak och strävar efter att vara proaktiva och innovativa i vårt arbete. Teamet består av en bra blandning av åldrar och kön, vilket skapar en dynamisk och inkluderande arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Länsförsäkringar Bank är idag Sveriges femte största bank och erbjuder ett brett sortiment av produker och tjänster till våra privat-, företag- och lantbrukskunder. I arbetet mot vår vision "Tillsammans skapar vi trygghet och möjligheter" hoppas vi att du vill bidra med ditt engagemang och nyfikenhet för effektivisering, AI samt omvärldsspaning av moderna verktyg och metoder för att driva vår utveckling framåt
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-15**

title: Är du vår nästa Data engineer inom analytics?
description:
**Brinner du för Data & Analytics? Är du på jakt efter det där avgörande steget som kommer att lyfta din karriär till nya höjder? Då har du hittat rätt!** 




  





**Hos Avega Data & Analytics letar vi efter just dig – en dedikerad Data engineer, full av driv och redo att omvandla din tekniska skicklighet till fantastiska lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad. Missa inte chansen att bli en del av vårt härliga team och forma framtiden med oss!** 




  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 




 Vårt mål är att vara den mest utvecklande arbetsplatsen i din karriär. Vårt unika forum för kompetensutveckling – Elevate – har över 70 föreläsningar och workshops om året. Utöver Elevate delar vi kunskap kontinuerligt genom bl a livliga chattar, Lunch’n’Learn, och ML Hackatons.
 



  





 Vår matchningsprincip 1:1 innebär att vi alltid strävar efter 100% matchning mellan våra kompetenser och våra kunders utmaningar – vi är aktivt med och väljer våra konsultuppdrag för att uppnå kontinuerlig utveckling och engagemang. För oss är rätt utmaning för varje individ avgörande för att lyckas i rollen.
 



  





 Vi återfinns i de flesta branscher i den svenska arbetsmarknaden, och vi väljer gärna kunder och uppdrag som både utvecklar oss som konsulter och som gynnar samhället i stort.
 



 På Avega delar vi generöst med oss av vår kunskap och är alltid redo att lära av varandra, i en atmosfär präglad av ömsesidig respekt och prestigelöshet. Det skapar en familjär och uppmuntrande arbetsmiljö för alla.
 



  





**Dina kvalifikationer** 



* **Programmeringsspråk:** 
 Starka färdigheter i SQL, Python, och möjligen andra språk som Java eller Scala.
* **Databasteknik:** 
 Erfarenhet av relationsdatabaser (RDBMS), NoSQL-databaser, och kunskaper inom databasdesign och optimering.
* **Molntekniker:** 
 Erfarenhet av att arbeta med molntjänster som AWS, Azure, och GCP, inklusive specifika verktyg för datahantering som BigQuery, Dataflow, och Azure Data Factory.
* **DevOps och automatisering:** 
 Kunskap om automatiseringsverktyg och processer, inklusive CI/CD, Terraform och Git.
* **Språk:** 
 Goda kunskap i svenska och engelska – både i tal och skrift.
* **Erfarenhet:** 
 minst 5 års arbetserfarenhet som data engineer.



  





**Meriterande** 



* **Dataanalys och visualisering** 
 : Förmåga att skapa insiktsfulla rapporter och dashboards, samt kompetens inom dataanalysverktyg så som i Tableau, Qlik eller Power BI.



  





 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din Analytics-karriär och göra en verklig skillnad med dina färdigheter inom data engineering?
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig och utforska hur du kan bidra till vårt team!

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.**
 We're looking for a Senior Fullstack Engineer to join our new Retain Team. You'll be a key driver in shaping our user experience, taking ownership of the frontend while also helping us shape our team’s first backend service in Go. This is a unique opportunity for a seasoned frontend expert to influence our user journey from onboarding to retention and exit. This position is perfect for an experienced, curious engineer who takes initiative, enjoys mentoring others, and is passionate about using data and experimentation to uncover actionable insights.
   

  

 As a team, we value open collaboration, tackling complex technical challenges together, and sharing knowledge through pair and mob programming, as well as regular hack weeks. As a senior member, your insights will shape and influence the team's roadmap, so we're looking for someone who thrives in a dynamic environment and embraces uncertainty.
   

  

 Your role will include but not be limited to:
   

  

* Taking the lead on frontend architecture and development, with a focus on improving user engagement and retention.
* Shaping our team's first backend service in Go, in collaboration with the team.
* Mentoring other engineers, sharing your expertise in modern frontend development.
* Driving the design and testing of small-scale UX improvements, leveraging data to iterate and refine solutions.
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to implement retention strategies across the organization and a cohesive and seamless user experience.


**Who You Are**
* 5+ years of extensive experience in frontend development, with experience (or a willingness to learn) backend systems.
* Deep expertise in TypeScript, React, and Next.js/Node.js.
* API-first mindset with a passion for scalable architecture and integrating complex systems.


**Nice to have**
* Experience with subscription services or e-commerce frontend interfaces.
* Knowledge of DevOps tools, such as Kubernetes and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies and an experimentation mindset to refine UX through data-driven insights.
* Experience building backend services (we use Go)


**Soft Skills**
* Adaptability: Quickly adjust to changing priorities and evolving technologies in a fast-paced scale-up environment.
* Collaboration: Strong teamwork abilities for effective cross-functional engagement and knowledge sharing.
* Problem-Solving Mindset: Proactively identify challenges and devise innovative solutions to drive progress and improve processes.


**Equal opportunity employer**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Apply now by clicking the link below! We embrace a hybrid model but love collaborating in person, so we spend the majority of our time in the office.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Data Scientist | Customer Insight & Analytics
description:
**The Opportunity**
We’re currently looking for a Data Scientist to join our Customer Insight & Analytics team. Someone who is passionate about data-driven decision-making, has a strong analytical mindset, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. If you have a passion for uncovering insights, leveraging AI, and making a meaningful impact, this role is for you.
This position offers flexibility with a hybrid work model, combining remote work with regular collaboration at our Gothenburg office. We believe in balancing in-person teamwork with focused individual work to maximize both productivity and innovation. **The Role**
In this role, you’ll be expected to apply advanced analytics, machine learning, and statistical modeling techniques to extract valuable insights, optimize customer engagement, and drive business impact.
See below for a more thorough breakdown of the various tasks and areas you’ll be responsible for:Analyzing large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Developing predictive models and machine learning algorithms to enhance decision-making.
Designing and implementing data visualization for stakeholders.
Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including Digital, operations, and product development.
Communicating findings effectively to technical and non-technical audiences.
  

**The Ideal Candidate**
To succeed in this role, you should be highly analytical, adaptable, and a strong communicator. You should enjoy working in a collaborative environment and be able to manage multiple projects with a strategic approach.**Required Skills & Experience:**3+ years of experience in data analysis, data science, or a related field.
Strong proficiency in Python or R, combined with strong SQL skills.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) is a plus.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights clearly.
A solid understanding of statistics and optimization techniques.
Knowledge of data security and ethical considerations in data analysis.

Polestar is an international company, with various backgrounds represented. English, therefore, is the language of written and spoken communication. And though we have a global presence, we maintain the growth-mindset. Change happens often at Polestar. But so does progress. Expect an accelerating, exciting environment.**The process**
If the above matches your ambitions, we’d love to hear from you! Applications will initially close on 29th August.
**Department**
Customer Experience
**Locations**
Gothenburg, Sweden
**Remote status**
Hybrid
**Employment type**
Full-time

description:
General information
Country
Sweden


City

FULL\_TIME
