title: AI Engineer
description:
**About Mynt**


Mynt is an all-in-one corporate card and spend management solution, on a mission to fundamentally change business banking forever. Our digital software, coupled with corporate cards and payments infrastructure, eradicates manual administrative tasks relating to spending for businesses. Mynt is experiencing huge growth in the Nordic markets, serving over 16,000 business customers with year-over-year growth exceeding 100%. We have recently secured substantial funding to support our continued expansion in Sweden and internationally.


Mynt is a tech-first company with a product oriented mindset, empowering teams to be their best in ideating and creating innovative solutions to complex problems. In 2021, Mynt obtained financial license as an E-money institution, card issuer, and payment processor from the Swedish Financial Supervisory Authority.


Since 2022, we’ve launched several strategic partnerships, starting with Fortnox where we integrated corporate cards directly into their platform. In early 2023, we announced a similar partnership with Accountor Group in Finland. Since then, additional integrations have gone live — including Kleer and Wint. Additional partnerships are in progress and under development.


Joining Mynt means contributing to creating an exceptional product and company. We seek passionate individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritizing customer value. With around 70 employees (and growing fast), we plan to further expand our team to support our growth.

**About the Role**


We are looking for top developers who have a passion for development and a deep interest in AI technologies, particularly in designing and building autonomous agents and agentic workflows. You'll thrive in our entrepreneurial environment where there's great opportunity to influence results and the company's progress. With us, you'll work in a modern codebase using the latest technologies, experiment with cutting-edge AI frameworks, and take on significant personal responsibility in shaping how intelligent agents transform our products.


**What you bring to the table:**

* Bachelor/Engineering degree or equivalent
* At least 1+ years of relevant work experience, preferably using Java or Python
* Ability to write well-documented, clean code
* You truly enjoy finding innovative solutions together with your team
* Fluent in Swedish and English

**What we can offer you:**

* Be part of an amazing team in a fast-growing scale-up.
* Work closely with a fun, high-performing team.
* Enjoy a flexible working environment with a great office location in central Stockholm.
* Shape your own development and responsibilities based on your passion and interest.

*The position will be filled as soon as we find a suitable candidate. Please reach out to us as soon as possible if you believe this for you!*

title: Technical Lead
description:
**We are now looking for a Partner Engineer/Technical Lead within Automotive Camera Modules and Embedded Platforms for a global company in Lund.**

 **Start is in September 2025, 6 month's contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**

 **Job Description:**


We are seeking a highly motivated and technically skilled individual to join our Technology Exploration Department (TED) in Lund as an engineer for our Automotive project. The Automotive project is focused on hardware and software solutions for the next generation automotive platforms. The successful candidate will be the main responsible for testing, evaluating, and developing hardware and software solutions as well as creating intuitive and innovative content to enable internal and external partners to use products. The work will include creating fast turn-around applications or tutorials using the APIs to ease the onboarding for customer.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct thorough testing of camera modules, SDKs, and automotive computing platforms to ensure optimal performance, functionality, and compatibility.
* Document best practices, create sample code projects, write tutorials and developer guides to promote and educate the developer-users.
* Create comprehensive documentation for products, including user manuals, technical specifications, and application notes, enabling external engineers to effectively test, evaluate, and develop proof of concept devices using company's technology.
* Own and maintain a dedicated web page that hosts the documentation and acts as a primary support platform, handling user tickets and utilizing CRM functionalities.
* Contribute to and lead in-depth technical webinars aimed at developers and users of the automotive development kit.
* Provide first-line support and educational assistance to external customers as well as internal entities in Europe, such as sales and external relations departments, ensuring they are well-informed about technology capabilities and features.
* Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the latest computing platforms, camera modules, and SDKs, staying up-to-date with advancements in the field
* Collaborate closely with the engineering team in Japan to provide valuable feedback based on test results, identifying areas for improvement and optimization.

**Requirements:**

* Proven experience in software development, camera technologies, or working with automotive computing platforms like NVIDIA Jetson or Drive, Qualcomm, or Texas Instruments
* Strong programming skills in C/C++ and Python, with hands-on experience involving image sensors, vision pipelines, and multimedia frameworks such as GStreamer
* Proficient in Linux/WSL, with experience managing drivers and embedded OS
* Experience with Implementing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for documentation testing and verification.
* Familiar with Docker technologies and scripting
* Familiar with Git workflow and using GitLab
* Knowledge of image sensors, ISP, and deserializer technologies
* Experience working with Markdown documentation (preferably AsciiDoc)
* Nice to have: familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs), prompt engineering, or integrating AI tools into development workflows
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze and interpret test results.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders in different geographical locations and actively contribute to webinars, presentations, and knowledge-sharing sessions
* A self-driven and proactive mindset, coupled with a willingness to learn and contribute to the team's success.
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field
* Familiar with Agile methodologies (Kanban workflows, JIRA, etc).
* Awareness of automotive industry trends and safety standards

  

This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Lund. Start is in September 2025, 6 month's contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Embedded Engineer - Automotive
description:
Want to take your coding skills to the next level in embedded systems development within Automotive? Look no further! Knowit Connectivity is an enthusiastic and rapidly expanding IT consultancy firm that thrives on innovation and technology. As we continue to grow, we're on the hunt for skilled and ambitious individuals to join our team and help us achieve even greater success.
   

  

**Your role as an Automotive Engineer**
 We are looking for you who enjoys being part of a team and take responsibility for your contribution to the team. Flexibility and curiosity are words that fit you together with an innovative and open mind to other ideas and input. Our ideal candidates is more than an experts - they're an exceptional communicators, a proactive problem-solvers, and a dedicated learner who passionately imparts knowledge to their peers. We do also value your curiosity and interest in the technical prospect, as our world and the industry environments constantly are changing. Our customers are within the Stockholm region and today we have a hybrid way of working with a mix of onsite, in-house and remote work depending on the projects.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we expect you to have experience in:**
* Either C++/C programming or model based development using Simulink
* End-to-end development (Design, implementation, documentation, testing, verification, validation…)
* Linux
* Knowledge of ISO26262, ISO 21434, and/or A-SPICE


**It is meriting if you also have experience in one or more of the following:**
* Working with automotive communication (e.g. CAN, Automotive Ethernet, etc.)
* Working with real-time systems
* Scripting in Python
* Testing on unit, integration and/or system level
* Testing using HIL, PIL and/or SIL.


**Other things that would be interesting if you had experience in are**
* Requirements management
* Working with Autosar; classic or adaptive
* Experience in working with verification and validation
* Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, etc)


 This job requires that you can express yourself well in English and Swedish, both verbally and in writing.
   

  

**About Us**
 Knowit offers an exciting workplace that provides great opportunities for our employees to develop, both professionally and personally. With supportive, versatile, and creative colleagues, we at Knowit Connectivity Stockholm offer an exciting and inclusive culture where we strive to ensure a healthy balance between private life and professional life. In addition to complementing each other professionally, we also make sure we have fun together, both inside and outside of office hours, with a variety of events such as workshops, informative seminars and casual after-works.
   

  

 All our leaders have a great focus on our employees and through a close dialogue with you, we promise to do our utmost to make the next project the best of your life so far. We are a company that values a culture of closeness and community. We listen when you have suggestions for improvements or new ideas for events and will always encourage you to try new solutions. Knowit is a fast-paced, fun, and inspiring workplace with a great team spirit. With us, you work to make a difference and to develop both Knowit’ s business and our customers.
   

  

**Application**
 Apply now trough the link or contact responsible recruiter Rasmus Lundin rasmus.lundin@knowit.se or hiring manager Joakim Oscarsson, joakim.oscarsson@knowit.se for more information or questions.

title: Test Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 Our group – TGRPDTT Transmission Component Testing and Gear Technology- works with the design, testing, and validation of torque transfer components in main and planetary gearbox i.e. gears, shafts and bearings. We are also responsible for radial seals, rotor bearings, and the odd screw and retaining ring in the gearbox shafts system.
   

  

 Today we are a group of 11 people as gear designers and test engineers that work together in a customer-centric and exploring approach. When developing our customer solutions, we are organized in virtual and cross-functional value creation flows according to the Traton tailored SAFE framework. In these teams we interact across different functions in Industrial Operations and are in frequent collaboration with assembly, machining, suppliers or sourcing department at Scania. Developing for all of Traton, we also work together with MAN and International and develop for our global production in EU, South America and Asia.
   

  

 As a group we come together around our shared competence area (gears, shafts, bearings) where we integrate collected knowledge from the product flows and build competence, assure quality and long term methods and technical development. Challenges of increasing importance relates to electrified drivetrains affecting system design and materials, compact designs with maintained or improved efficiency and durability, data-driven development, and methods for faster development iterations.
   

  

 We are a mixed group in terms of experience where some have worked for more than twenty years in the field, and others for one year. Together the group holds a lot of knowledge and expertise and we promote a helpful, inclusive and supportive work environment. Discussions, troubleshooting, and analysis are part of our daily work and we are transparent and humble in our interactions. We are curious and we learn together as we apply ourselves to new challenges.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Your main tasks as a test engineer will include:
   

  

  

* Be part of our innovative team developing and verifying our products
* Help create insights into future product solutions and solve challenges connected to current products
* Performing hands-on tests in our rigs, together with a team of ambitious test engineers and in close collaboration with the design engineers.
* Develop our test methods, especially for emerging e-mobility products and data driven decision making. You will play an important part in this process
* Analyse test results to determine the next step in the product development and verification plan
* Automation and scripting


 You will follow the development of the hardware from idea to finalized product and will be an important part of the continuous learning in the team.
   

  

**Your Profile**
 The right candidate should have an engineering or master's degree in mechanical engineering, materials technology, vehicle technology or similar, and preferably some experience in related fields. A high level of initiative and good cooperation skills are necessary. We are looking for you that are curious, problem-solving, and driven to deliver results.
   

  

 Meritorious skills and knowledge include:
   

  

  

* Planetary or gearbox construction
* Material technology and processing, such as casting and hardening
* Programming skills (Python, Matlab or similar)
* Softwares INCA, DEWESoft
* Automatic control
* Acoustics or NVH engineering


**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally. Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-29. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Matej Lukanovic, Unit Manager at TGRPDTT, matej.lukanovic@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Data Engineer
company_industry: Software Development, Data Infrastructure and Analytics, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Ready to reimagine the future of retail?** 




  





 At Bambuser, we’re transforming how the world shops online by bringing video commerce to life for some of the world’s most beloved brands. Our customers’ success is our passion, and we believe in the potential of every individual. Together, we’re building the future of retail, with data playing a central role in how we operate, grow, and make decisions.
 



 We offer an open, honest, and friendly workplace where every opinion matters. Conversations can get lively because we care deeply about what we build. But we always have each other’s backs and make space to enjoy the ride.
 



**Join Bambuser as a Data Engineer and help us take our data platform to the next level.** 
 From product analytics to business-critical insights, you’ll be working at the core of our data ecosystem. Your work will enable smarter decisions, faster development, and better collaboration across the company. If you’re passionate about building reliable pipelines, designing scalable architecture, and contributing to a curious, capable team, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





**What You’ll Do**



* **Build & Scale:** 
 Design, implement, and maintain our data platform on GCP (BigQuery, Dataflow, Airflow, Pub/Sub), ensuring pipelines are reliable, efficient, and secure.
* **ELT Excellence:** 
 Create robust ELT workflows using Dataform/dbt, SQL, and Python to transform raw data into analytics-ready datasets.
* **Architectural Leadership:** 
 Lead discussions on data architecture, deployment automation, and CI/CD practices to streamline our data workflows and ensure maintainability.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Partner closely with analysts, developers, and product teams to capture requirements, shape data-driven features, and deliver actionable insights.
* **Observability & Quality:** 
 Implement monitoring, logging, and governance processes to ensure data reliability, accuracy, and documentation.



  





**Who you are**




 We believe you have:
 


* Strong proficiency in SQL and Python.
* Hands-on experience with GCP data technology: BigQuery, Dataflow, Airflow, Pub/Sub, or equivalent.
* A proven track record building and scaling data pipelines at production scale.
* Experience with ELT/ETL frameworks such as Dataform or dbt\_.
* Solid software engineering practices: version control (Git), automated testing, and CI/CD.
* Excellent communication skills; adept at working with cross-functional stakeholders.
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience)



 We'd consider it a bonus if you have experience with:
 



 Terraform, Docker, Kubernetes, streaming data architectures, client-side logging, or observability tools such as Prometheus and Grafana.
 



  





  





**Curiosity** 
 , clear
 **communication** 
 , and a
 **thoughtful** 
 approach to problem-solving go a long way in this role. We value people who ask good questions and enjoy learning as part of a team.
 



  





**Tools we use**




 GCP | BigQuery | Dataform | Dataflow | Airflow | Terraform | Python | Cube.dev | Steep | Embeddable
 



  





**Why join Bambuser?**




 We’re pioneers in live commerce, partnering with some of the world’s most loved brands to create engaging and innovative shopping experiences. As part of our growing team, you’ll help scale a platform that is changing how people shop online.
 



 At Bambuser, you’ll take ownership of meaningful projects, face new challenges, and contribute directly to the development of our product. The work you do will have real impact and be used by thousands of shoppers in real time.
 



 This role is based in Stockholm and offers a flexible work setup. You’ll have the freedom to focus from home when needed, while also spending time with your team in our beautiful office in the city center.
 



  





  





**This is Bambuser**




 Bambuser’s Video Commerce technology drives customer engagement and sales for some of the world’s largest brands and retailers. At the forefront of live streaming technology since 2007, Bambuser launched interactive eCommerce solutions in 2019 and quickly became the platform of choice for companies worldwide. Our team has established long-term partnerships and supported campaign activations for brands and retailers including Adidas, Hugo Boss, brands within the LVMH group, Clarins, Selfridges, Sonos, and many others.
 



*Bambuser values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds, regardless of where you come from or what you believe.*

title: Application Engineer - Verification IP - EDA - m/f/d
description:
**About Us**
 Siemens EDA is a global technology leader in Electronic Design Automation software. Our software tools enable companies around the world to develop new and highly innovative electronic products faster and more cost-effectively. Our customers use our tools to push the boundaries of technology and physics in order to deliver better products in the increasingly complex world of chip, board and system design.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are looking for a highly motivated Application Engineer who will be responsible for the technical selling and support of Siemens EDA's Verification IP (VIP) portfolio across the EMEA region.
   

  

 As an Application Engineer (AE), you’ll play a pivotal role as the bridge between Siemens EDA and our customers. This dynamic and challenging position demands profound technical expertise, robust communications, and exemplary business skills. Collaborating with businesses spanning diverse technology sectors, you’ll assist our customers in tackling technical and business challenges using Siemens EDA's innovative verification solutions. As part of our technical sales team, you'll contribute to the growth of Siemens EDA's functional verification business in EMEA by ensuring the successful adoption and expansion of our products and services.
   

  

 As a Verification IP AE, you will identify and qualify engagements based on customers' needs and business opportunities, define VIP evaluations and benchmark criteria, implement relevant technical campaigns to meet established goals considering customers' production flows, provide best-in-class support, and work with account managers to determine the sales execution strategy. You will ensure both the customers' success and the broader use of Siemens EDA's VIP solutions. Our application engineering team is a creative, dynamic, and highly productive small team environment.
   

  

 Work location is in Europe with the applicant expected to be able to easily travel within the European Union and other EMEA countries such as the UK and Israel. This position can entail as much as 20% travel.
   

  

 Job Responsibilities:
   

  

* The primary purpose is to work with sales and field technical team members to help lead, define, and implement the technical engagements that support sales campaigns.
* Provide technical leadership on all aspects of sales campaigns. Contribute and complete pre-sales and post-sales account strategies as a member of the sales team.
* Qualify the technical viability of sales opportunities and communicate them to the sales team.
* Lead VIP portfolio presentations and demonstrations to prospective customers and effectively communicate the value proposition of Siemens EDA solutions to them
* Integrate VIP in customer testbench or guide them to do so themselves.
* Proactively share account, evaluation, competitor, technology, and other helpful information with peers, sales teams, management, and product divisions to help us compete more effectively.
* Develop and maintain ongoing positive relationships with customers.
* Ensure customers receive timely, effective support
* Influence marketing and product groups to meet customers’ needs and shape product direction.
* Work collaboratively with team members to ensure mutual success.


 Job Qualifications:
   

  

* The successful candidate will possess the following combination of education and experience:
* BS in Electrical or Computer Engineering or equivalent.
* Practical experience and knowledge of one or more high-speed interface protocols such as PCIe, CXL, UCIe, NVMe, Ethernet, USB, DDRx, HBM, AMBA.
* Knowledge of controllers for one or more high-speed interface protocols
* Expertise in coding with SystemVerilog, and UVM is mandatory
* Experience with integrating commercial VIP in SV/UVM bench required.
* Experience with Linux and Windows environments including scripting languages.
* Individual leadership and initiative to manage pre-sales accounts
* Excellent presentation skills and verbal/written communication skills
* Strong project management skills and the ability to break down complex problems into manageable tasks


**Working at Siemens EDA**
**Why us?**
 Working at Siemens EDA means flexibility - Choosing between working at home and the office at other times is the norm here. We offer great benefits and rewards, as you'd expect from a world leader in industrial software.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Javautvecklare till PostNord i Stockholm
description:
**Vill du utveckla lösningar som påverkar miljontals användare i Norden varje dag? Som Javautvecklare hos PostNord gör du just det!**
 Om du är Javautvecklare, motiveras av att hantera hög datatrafik, använda senaste tekniken och utveckla lösningar som används av samt påverkar människor från norr till söder i hela Norden, då är detta en roll för dig! Hos PostNord kommer du in i ett engagerat team som skapar lösningar för PostNords app, aviseringar och leveranspreferenser. Med fokus på modern teknik och agila arbetssätt får du möjlighet att påverka och utvecklas – både som individ och i teamet.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
 Vi erbjuder ett omväxlande arbete i en internationell miljö med ständigt nya utmaningar och snabba beslut. Här får du möjlighet att utveckla kreativa lösningar under eget ansvar och arbeta i en prestigelös grupp där vi gemensamt hjälps åt att nå våra mål.
   

  

 PostNord Är En Av Sveriges Största Arbetsplatser Och Vi Erbjuder Trygga Anställningsvillkor, Kollektivavtal Och Förmåner. Bland Annat Erbjuder Vi
   

  

* Flexibel hybrid arbetsplats med ett öppet arbetsklimat
* Många utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter
* Goda försäkrings- och tjänstepensionsvillkor
* Friskvårdsbidrag och tillgång till kontor Arkens gym och simhall
* Ett rikt utbud av aktiviteter och erbjudanden inom områdena semester, idrott, kultur och wellness via vår egen Personalstiftelse PostNord Plus.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Som Javautvecklare Bidrar Du Till Att Göra Vardagen Enklare För Nordiska Konsumenter Genom Att Göra E-handel Och Logistik Enkelt. Mer Specifikt Kokar Det Ner Till Att
   

  

* Utveckla och underhålla backend-tjänster för aviseringar, app och preferenshantering.
* Arbeta med mikrotjänster och skalbara system för att hantera hög datatrafik.
* Bidra till att skapa användarvänliga lösningar med stor påverkan på konsumentupplevelsen.
* Samarbeta med kollegor både lokalt och globalt i ett agilt team.


 Beroende på din erfarenhet kan du här utvecklas antingen som specialist eller i mer coachande roll.
   

  

**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du blir en del av teamet System Components som arbetar med utvecklingen av PostNords konsumentlösningar.
   

  

 Teamet består av sju engagerade medlemmar och de äger sina lösningar, sin infrastruktur och det finns en blandning av både utvecklings- och mer operationsinriktade kollegor. Det finns en kultur präglad av samarbete, lärande och psykologisk trygghet. Ni arbetar nära intressenter och andra avdelningar för att säkerställa hög kvalitet och pålitliga lösningar.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att designa, utveckla och förvalta mikrotjänster från grunden. Du har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och kan redogöra för konkreta exempel på tidigare projekt där du har bidragit med tekniska lösningar som skapat verkligt affärsvärde.
   

  

 Vi tror att du delar vår övertygelse om värdet i att leverera ofta och i små inkrementella steg. I teamet arbetar vi gärna med parprogrammering och kunskapsdelning - något vi värdesätter högt och ser att du också gör.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Minst fem års arbetslivserfarenhet av Java, Spring Boot och databasdesign
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar, AWS är meriterande
* Kunskap om Kubernetes och containerbaserade lösningar
* Du behärskar engelska flytande i både tal och skrift, svenska är meriterande


 Vi ser gärna att du har ett intresse för att förenkla vardagen för konsumenter som skickar och tar emot paket. Har du dessutom en nyfikenhet och vilja att kontinuerligt utvecklas inom ditt område – då är du den vi söker.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Data Engineer med fokus på DevOps
description:
För vår kund
 **Finansinspektionen i Stockholm** 
 söker vi en erfaren
 **Data Engineer** 
 med fokus på DevOps för att sätta upp en ny analysplattform med komponenter och pipelines.
   

  

 Finansinspektionen står inför ett strategiskt initiativ att införa en ny analysplattform som ska stödja verksamhetens ökade behov av datadrivna beslut. Plattformen ska möjliggöra modern dataanalys, visualisering och rapportering, samt integreras med befintliga datakällor och system.
   

  

 Finansinspektionen söker därför efter en data engineer med stark DevOps-profil som har erfarenhet av att utveckla hybrida analysplattformar baserade på open source-verktyg i containerbaserade miljöer.
   

  

**Skall-krav**
* Designa, bygga och underhålla containerbaserade lösningar för datahantering och analys.
* Automatisera och optimera pipelines för dataflöden modellkörningar och plattformsdrift.
* Integrera och konfigurera open source-verktyg inom dataanalys, exempelvis Apache Airflow, dbt, JupyterHub eller liknande
* Säkerställa robusthet, skalbarhet och säkerhet i plattformens infrastruktur.
* Stötta teamet med DevOps-principer och kunskapsöverföring.
* Erfarenhet från finansiell sektor och/eller myndighet
* Förstå svenska i tal och i skrift


**Mervärdeskrav:**
* Bör ha erfarenhet av uppdrag med It inom finansiell sektor och/eller myndighet
* Bör ha arbetat med Docker och Kubernetes i on prem -miljöer
* Bör ha erfarenhet av att konfigurera orkestrering i mha Airflow, Dagster eller liknande verktyg
* Bör ha erfarenhet av att sätt upp automatiserade tester
* Bör ha erfarenhet av att jobba agilt enligt SAFE-ramverket

title: Capacity Analyst
description:
Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 SSC also has one of the world’s largest global networks of ground stations for satellite communications. We own and operate the Esrange Space Center in Kiruna, northern Sweden, with the aim of launching satellites in the near future.
   

  

**Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace?**
**Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space?** 
  

  

 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as a Capacity Analyst in our team. We are now expanding our engineering team and are looking for a Systems Engineer who will focus on Capacity Analysis, a key role responsible forecasting and planning our satellite communications service capacity, ensuring our systems can meet the evolving needs of customer space missions, from months to several years in advance.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 As a Systems Engineer for Capacity Analysis, you will:
   

  

* Maintain a long-term commitment overview of our services demand across global sites
* Analyze various capacity scenarios such as growth, outages, network expansion - to support data-driven decisions.
* Perform pre-sales analysis of capacity needs for individual missions.
* Develop and refine analytical models to simulate and forecast resource needs, such as antenna availability, terrestrial network capacity, data storage and compute resources.
* Provide technical insight for accepting new services and customers.
* Contribute to the development of tools and methods for capacity analysis, independently or in collaboration with our software team.
* Engage with stakeholders to optimize use of SSC's satellite communication services.


**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for someone who:
   

  

* Has excellent technical skills and a desire to learn new things, likely excited about the growing space industry.
* Has a structured and analytical mindset, with the ability to manage long-term planning and complex data.
* Holds a university degree in systems engineering, space engineering, computer science, or a related field.
* Understands technical systems in operational environments—ideally in space, ground stations, or complex networks.
* Is comfortable working with data and can use tools like Python, to build analyses.
* Can clearly communicate technical insights to both engineering and non-technical stakeholders


**While not required, we especially value experience in:**
* Orbit dynamics and space mission design
* Spacecraft operations
* Ability to actively contribute to or lead the development of analysis tools in Python


**WE OFFER YOU**
* A unique opportunity to contribute to a wide range of projects and play an active role in both the Swedish and international space industry.
* An excellent opportunity for personal and career development.
* An exciting, international workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.


**Additional Benefits (applies In Sweden)**
* In addition to vacation and traditional public holidays, we offer extra paid leave throughout the year, such as time off between Christmas and New Year, Ascension Day, amounting to 6-11 extra days depending on the calendar.
* Wellness allowance of SEK 5,000 per year.
* Health benefits such as voluntary health insurance and regular health checks for eligeble employees.
* Access to a benefit bike through a tax-efficient leasing program.
* Support for employee-driven activities that promote connection, health, and culture across teams.
* Collective Agreement, including good pensions plans, parental pay and insurance.


**LOCATION**
 This is a full-time permanent position, located at either Solna or Kiruna, Sweden.
   

  

**FURTHER INFORMATION**
 For questions regarding employment terms or union-related matters, you are welcome to contact our union representatives:
   

  

**Sveriges Ingenjörer** 
 : SverigesIngenjorer-AF@sscspace.com
   

  

**Unionen** 
 : unionen@sscspace.com
   

  

**NEXT STEP**
 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait to apply! We will review applications on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications.   This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**
 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space. Learn more at sscspace.com

title: Senior Level Design Supervisor
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 Battlefield is a storied franchise renowned for uncompromising combat gameplay for over two decades. 100 million players and 5 billion hours played later, the Battlefield team is looking to define the future of the first-person shooter. United the banner of Battlefield Studios, 4 world-class teams across Criterion, DICE, Motive and Ripple Effect have come together to focus on the future of the franchise, a connected Battlefield universe filled with immersive experiences built on our unique DNA.
   

  

 LET’S PUSH THINGS FORWARD
   

  

 DICE is a creative studio with offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg. We believe in the power of diversity and welcome game creators from all backgrounds to collaborate with us as we unlock the potential for the future of Battlefield!
   

  

 We’re always pushing to be at the forefront of creative entertainment - blending digital art, design, and technology to push boundaries. Our collaborative culture is fueled by passion, driving innovation and making a positive difference for our players and community.
   

  

 At DICE, your ideas matter. We offer an inclusive space where you can thrive, be yourself, and grow alongside a team dedicated to making a meaningful impact to the world of gaming.
   

  

 We’re all-in on the future and our most ambitious Battlefield yet. Want to be part of something special? Read on.
   

  

**Level Design Supervisor**
 Are you passionate about multiplayer shooters and excited to shape iconic Battlefield moments? EA DICE is looking for a
 **Senior Level Designer** 
 to help lead the design of engaging, memorable multiplayer maps in collaboration with our global co-development (codev) partners. In this key role, you’ll report to the Studio Level Design Director and take ownership of the multiplayer map experience from concept to final polish.
   

  

 This role is ideal for someone who enjoys working across teams, cultures, and time zones to shape gameplay experiences that millions of players will enjoy. You'll collaborate with multiple studios to guide the vision, pacing, and layout of multiplayer maps—helping bring the Battlefield experience to life across several unique environments.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Own the multiplayer map experience from initial concept through post-launch refinement, ensuring consistent quality and alignment with the project level design direction.
* Lead and inspire international co-development teams, providing design direction, technical guidance, and design mentorship to deliver high-quality multiplayer experiences.
* Partner closely with art, narrative, gameplay, and technical teams to deliver a cohesive, player-first experience across all disciplines.
* Champion the design vision—balancing moment-to-moment action, long-term engagement, and strategic depth.
* Teach and enforce design best practices, raising the overall quality bar across partner teams.
* Facilitate clear, decisive communication across multiple studios, resolving design challenges with creative and technical solutions.
* Provide hands-on contributions to level design when needed.
* Drive innovation in map design, leveraging player feedback, data, and competitive analysis to evolve the Battlefield experience.


**What We’re Looking For**
* 7+ years of multiplayer level design experience, including multiple shipped AAA titles in the shooter/action genre.
* Proven track record of leading cross-disciplinary teams and delivering high-quality multiplayer content at scale.
* Strong proficiency in blockout tools, iteration workflows, and proprietary or industry-standard level editors.
* Demonstrated ability to set and maintain a creative vision while aligning diverse teams to that vision.
* Exceptional communication skills with a collaborative, player-first mindset.
* Experience working in multi-studio, co-development pipelines.
* Strategic thinker with a proactive, solution-oriented approach to design challenges.


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
